description:
After shopping at the Westfield Mall, great place to refuel and their Ramen is always Great.
Make sure you write your name and how many in your party for seating.
Great Service, after ordering food comes out pretty quick!!!
author: Wesley O.

description:
Service was better than what I expected.
I asked for a fork cuz I didn't want to use bleached chopsticks to get poisoned since I'm st my 60s. He agreed after I promised to bring it back to him.
The only thing I didn't liked was they put hot broth into a plastic container.
Different kinds of meats in One Roman entree was a good thing. First time I saw that.
author: Trudy L.

description:
This is going to be a somewhat "low 3," and I will break up my review into two parts.

First, the ramen itself. I love ramen, and my fiancee thought I would enjoy this place. The broth was hot and quite flavorful...very tasty, as was the pork. The noodles, however, tasted as if they weren't fully cooked yet, almost too "starchy," if you will. The biggest disappointment, however, was the egg. I love eggs in ramen, but this was served to me hard boiled. Eggs should not be cooked to the point of a Passover seder level of "hardness" when put into ramen.

The second was the deep fried mochi. She enjoyed it, and I don't know how. I suppose my tastebuds haven't attenuated to Japanese appetizer tastes, as this was literally unseasoned deep fried rice flour. What's the point?

I feel bad to give this place a 2, but I think if anything, a 3-, and probably won't recommend
author: Dan W.

description: I have a lot of ramen reviews so you can check out my other reviews. You'll see that I've had place in SoCal, Las Vegas, and other place in the Bay Area. I have even learned how to make ramen myself. I am a ramen snob. This place is a place I would recommend if you're in the area. After doing some shopping, this would be a great place to stop by. I ordered the ramen combo and the Ajisen Ramen. Both were fantastic. The broth was cooked perfectly as well as the chashu. This is one of the first place that I've had that served piece of ribs in the ramen, this add some good flavors to the ramen. The negative thing about the dish is the Ajisen Ramen only came with the seasoned egg but it only came with half the egg. Where is my whole egg?!!!  Needless to say, I was fulfilled after getting unfulfilled from the previous night's ramen. This one makes the good ramen places on my list.
author: Patrick T.

description: Just really average ramen. I think there are a lot of better places around the same price range. It has kind of a one-tone flavor? If that makes sense? So if you like less aromatic flavors than this might work better for you. The chaseau?meat? was really good.
author: Sujin S.

description:
Mehhh.

I discovered this ramen place my last visit to San Francisco, which was back in November. I didn't stop in Ajisen then, but I told myself I'd have to try it on a return trip.

It's in the middle of the Westfield Mall, but you have to wait to be seated and there is waiter service. The service was great my entire experience - all of the employees are very kind and they serve you quick.

I ended up going with the Spicy Miso Ramen, which is usually my go-to at any ramen joint. The menu has a TON of ramen options, but they also have other dishes as well as some sushi rolls. There's definitely a nice variety. They also have boba, Thai iced tea, Viet iced coffee, and more yummy drink options.

I read the Spicy Miso Ramen was a pork based broth - it was my first time having ramen where the broth was pretty much WHITE (before I mixed everything up and got the spicy paste integrated) but it smelled yummy! It also comes with an egg, as well as three slices of pork belly.

The pork belly was delicious - tender, great cuts of meat, and lots of flavor. I also like that they are big slices, but not so big that it's hard to maintain eating. The egg was actually really good too - I've always avoided eating the egg in my ramen and now I'm not sure what I was thinking all those times. The noodles were thinner then what I've had at other ramen places, but they had a good flavor. I wish that I got more noodles with the amount of broth I got... I'm an extra broth girl for sure, but I wouldn't have minded more noodles this time around! 

The broth is where the meal kind of fell short for me, and the broth is really what it comes down to. Aside from being nice and spicy (it'll make your nose run a little) it really wasn't all that flavorful. It definitely left me wanting to there to be more to it. 

If you're craving ramen and this is the only option, it's a decent choice. However, I've had better and Ajisen definitely falls short in comparison. Glad I tried them though!
author: Lauren P.

description:
Review #215 - 2018

The first time I came here, I thought the broth was much better; but then again, my memory might be wrong.

We came back on Saturday, July 21st, and put my name on the wait list.  It took about 15-20 minutes to get seated for our group of six.

The three of us got the spicy pork ramen, which was ok.  The broth wasn't as flavorful as I remembered from my first experience.  The noodles actually felt more like thin spaghetti noodles instead of ramen noodles so they didn't absorb any of the broth.

My niece got the seafood ramen, but I didn't get a picture of it.

I got an order of the fried chicken appetizer for my daughter and my little niece to share, but my niece doesn't really eat meat so she ended up eating just an order of edamame.  The fried chicken was actually pretty good.

Service was slow on both occasions so I'm not sure if it's because they're unstaffed or the waitstaffs are just slow.  

There were four girls working out front and the place isn't that big so I'm not sure why it still felt like everything was moving so slowly.
author: Sivilay T.

description: On the Spot Good Ramen .. good thing they have a list and your name will be called ..  less than 5 mins ..got the Beef Cury Ramen .. good choice.. hint check in with Yelp . They Give u a buy one get one drink..Good Place for a quick Lunch
author: Donovan L.

description: WOW this ramen is good. I actually didn't even look at yelp and just ran into this place while at Westfield. I think this has to be the best ramen I've had. I've been to the overhyped place in Japan town and I think this place is way better. The ramen had a nice broth and the noodles were cooked perfectly. Also the karage may be the best fried chicken I've ever had. So crunchy yet juicy. No wait and a lot of seating. No parking really because it's literally the mall downtown. #kevinissalivating
author: Kevin L.

description:
Aijisen Ramen, located downstairs in the Valley Fair Westfield Mall of San Francisco, is a hearty place to go if you are in the mall or downtown and want a filling meal. It might deter you cause it is located in a mall, but it is much better than the mall food surrounding it. It tastes just like the Aijisen in the Fremont Warm Springs location, but has a bigger menu. The service was very friendly and attentive for the spot located in the mall. There are a limited amount of seats, so coming on off-meal times is good.
I visited this location with a friend after walking around SF, and really wanted quality ramen. Thank god we found some here!
I got the new scallop ramen and my friend got one of the tonkatsu ramens. We both thoroughly enjoyed our noodles. The portions were of reasonable price and I would return again if I was in the area.
author: Lianne W.

description: Really friendly staff and quick seating. I recommend their scallop combo ramen. Reasonable prices and large portions.
author: Theresa Thao N.

description:
Ajisen, I am so glad you're in my life. Whether it'd be in LA, Hong Kong, ShangHai, or SF, you've never failed to impress me. 

Very fairly priced (ramen in SF is generally ~$15 a bowl), perfectly cooked noodles (not hard or too soft), flavorful broth, generous meat & other toppings - Ajisen is a hidden gem. Not to mention the convenient location. Ajisen is always poppin' (always a line out the door) and there is no reason for it not to be popular. 

In my opinion, Ajisen is so much better than many "we have the best ramen" places in SF. The consistency and variety of selection (for meat and veggie lovers) at Ajisen is the reason you should go.  If you don't want ramen, you can also get a rice bowl (unagi is bomb.com).There is something for everyone. 

For those of you who complained that the experience is "too fast"  - guys, have any of you been to Japan? Do you know how to eat ramen? Ramen is meant to be eaten fast, or your noodles will soak up all the soup and you'll have a huge bowl of....cold soggy noodles and you absolutely don't want that.
author: Dana Z.

description:
Overpriced mall ramen but if it's what you're craving then just do it. On a weekday afternoon it was only half full but the guy working there was about to seat us at a two top near the entrance. Being that it was cold I asked if we could sit at the back. He quickly told us they were saving the bigger tables for larger parties. I pointed out that the table only had room enough for two people as the group behind was taking up a lot of space. At that point he acquiesced - I also pointed out the restaurant was half empty!

I ordered the black truffle vegetable ramen ($15!) and my mom had the 1st combo ramen on the menu. While my truffle ramen was good, it was definitely not worth the hefty price tag. This is mall food, folks! And you're paying to sit like a squished sardine in a non-heated seating area with the restroom accessibility.
author: Tammy Y.

description: Great appetizers, Bubble Tea and Ramen. Service is quite slow but due to the nature of an Asian restaurant at the mall.
author: David C.

description: Quality ramen.. doesn't make you feel gross after you eat it like the last place I tried. I only get the chicken you have watch out with beef many places use cheap crap.... I come here every blue moon. I usually eat pho more often
author: Athena C.

description: It's a mall restaurant. It's good ramen for a mall restaurant. The people who work here are very nice!
author: Nic G.

description:
I have been on the biggest ramen kick lately, so yelp brought me here - unfortunately, I was not terribly impressed with what I ordered.

I tried:
-strawberry green tea: don't order. I should've known better, but didn't, and ended up drinking the taste-equivalent of a melted down cherry icee.
-roast black garlic oil ramen: flat and lacking dimension. I was not impressed with this at all.
-volcano ramen (spice on the side): as good as people say. My fiance ordered this, and I ate over half his bowl to compensate for mine

Line moves fast, staff is good at getting you in and out. I read a yelp review that said the guy is a hard worker, and I agree. We were lucky enough to have him as our server. :) Worth a stop if you're in the area, but not worth venturing out of your way to come here.
author: Michelle N.

description:
This place is pretty good for being located inside a mall! (But not mall prices)

The service was wonderful; they were attentive and accommodating. 

Tip: be sure to check in to get their buy one get one free drink with a purchase of an entree.

We ordered Thai teas, spicy ramen, and the other gals ordered the ramen with corn.

The broth was good, just wish they used better noodles. 

If I'm craving ramen and don't want to venture out, I might stop back in.
author: Jerrica N.

description:
My friends and I came here for dinner, and there wasn't much of a wait. It's a sit down restaurant in the mall, which was an odd concept at first considering it's right between two more express like food options, but we were served as usual.

The ramen was okay. I've had the one down in Irvine (I wonder if they are the same owner?), and the one at this location is slightly better, but still not all that amazing. There are big chunks of pork, and the broth is decent, but it lacks that finesse that usually comes out of really good ramen places.

On the bright side though, when we went they were offering buy one get one free boba drinks! Those were just average as well, but at about $2 each I'm not complaining!
author: Tyler T.

description:
Couple of friends and I were hungry, so they decided ramen. I was a bit iffy about it, but the vote was 3 against 1. 

I went w/the vegetarian ramen + shoyu broth not much comes in but corn, mushrooms and some greens. I asked her to add an egg, and crab which is $2.00 extra, the size of my thumb. 

Long story short, I was not diggin it at all. 
Our total came out to $80, I don't even know for what. 


I'm still on the search to find good non-pork ramen in the east bay. Any recommendations, message me :)
author: Lila M.

description:
We got the Ajisen best combo ($12) and gyoza four piece ($3.75). The ramen was pretty good and had good quality meat, surprisingly for a food court restaurant. 

The ramen portions are small compared to other Ajisen places for some reason. The gyoza was TINY I've never seen such small dumplings. Seems harder to make even! So not worth it. 

For $12 it's a solid and quick meal. The service is not very good, yet they insist of keeping the "pls wait to be seated" and presence of waiters. They should just make it a fast food place.
author: Shannon W.

description:
I really love this ramen spot! Came here on a Saturday afternoon and we were seated right away, we were able to order right away and we got our food almost instantly. I came with my parents and I got to spicy pork ramen with corn, my dad for the spicy beef ramen and my mom got the tender rib ramen. 

What's really important to me at ramen places is the temperature of the broth. I can't enjoy a good bowl of ramen if it's not hot enough. Luckily this place serves it to you at the perfect temperature. Warm enough to enjoy and not too hot where it'll burn your tongue. 

My bowl of spicy pork was delicious. It had a good amount of spice, nothing crazy spicy and the broth had so much flavor. Every bite was simply delectable and it was so good I finished the whole thing. It was different seeing a hard boiled egg though, since I'm used to the soft boiled eggs but nonetheless it was still enjoyable. 

My parents ramen were both very delicious, it had so much flavor in every bite. I was quite surprised at delicious it was, especially with how fast it came out. I definitely recommend this place and I will be back!
author: Kimberly D.

description:
There's usually a line here, especially during peak lunch hours. In fact, there's a sign up list at the entrance.   We came on a recent mid afternoon weekday to grab a late lunch and were immediately seated near the kitchen.

We shared two appetizers, the agedashi tofu (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=tSgtJ0bjTLXJMOwv3u9xZQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) and the grilled Hokkaido scallops (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=vXXE0ZTbG5u53qtZO7A8Ww&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) which were good but didn't notice any grill marks here.

For our main meal, we both ordered the Ajisen Best Combo Ramen (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wmq2LbHU_3_WlM2XDzpnxg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  It was not bad with no shortage of meats here; the star was the tender pork ribs (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=y9QXflgTghMtht8x48-Nug&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  The meat was melt-in-your mouth texture and the soft bones that joined the meat together also dissolved as you chewed.  The broth flavor didn't stand out though the noodles were chewy as I like them.

The dining room was more than half full at 2 pm when we started eating.  Service was quick and efficient.  Remember to check in on Yelp to enjoy a free beverage, Thai iced tea was my choice.

I now have a new lunch rotation spot near my office.
author: Mike C.

description: Wow! I had low expectations going into this, but I was realllly pleasantly surprised by this mall food court ramen! We had servers so it was a sit down restaurant experience. There's a ton of ramen options, and I ended up getting the volcano ramen. pro tip- ask for the spicy sauce on the side! That way you can control the spice level. When it came out it was already really spicy, so I'm VERY grateful I asked for the sauce on the side. I ended up adding just a little bit, but my coworker who got the whole thing in his broth was sitting there sweating! When I was done, I kept sipping the broth- the broth is really good! Very garlicky. The only thing is I wish there were more toppings- bean sprouts would've been nice (and corn is extra $2)- I like corn but not that much haha
author: Ke C.

description:
This is a pretty solid ramen spot. My friends rave about it all the time, so we finally decided to give it a try. 

Service was really quick. We were seated, served water, and had our order taken in about 10 minutes. I had the Ajisen Best Combo (ABC). The broth was really good -- rich and flavorful. It came with a trio of meats: bbq pork, premium pork, and pork ribs(?). None of the meats stood out to me, in flavor, but I did notice that all were very tender. Everything pretty much tasted the same as I was eating my way to the bottom of the bowl; but it was still a tasty meal. 

I'd for sure return if I were in the area and was craving soup. Fast service, decent prices, and yummy food that will hit the spot! :)
author: Liana B.

description:
Been here a few times with my wife. It's not the greatest ramen I've ever had, but when I'm craving ramen, it hits the spot. It's located in the lower level food court in the mall and can get pretty packed. They even have a sign up list in order to be seated. Staff is ok. They are friendly for the most part, but it definitely has a fast food feel. 

I've ordered some of their spicy ramen and it always didn't feel as spicy as I would like it, but this last time we went, I ordered the volcano ramen, which surprisingly had a good amount of spice and I was pleasantly surprised. Like I said, it's not the most authentic ramen I've ever had, but can fill a craving when having one. I don't know if it's just me, but I swear they use spaghetti noodles. If you like spicy, try their volcano ramen.
author: Joven S.

description: The gyoza was cooked perfectly and the spicy tuna was small but delicious. Would definitely return.
author: Joan P.

description:
TL;DR GREAT RAMEN FOR MALL FOOD

PLUSES:
+ right in the mall food court - very convenient 
+ quick service
+ overall, ramen was great, broth was yummy and flavorful, they have more spices available if you want to up your spice game

DELTAS:
- ramen was a kinda weird texture, reminded me of spaghetti
author: Sophia L.

description:
We love the Ramen here.  Even though I find slightly salty. A little hot water added makes it perfect.  

My girls 6 and 9 years old also Love the ramen here.  We usually get
- premium pork ramen or
- beef ramen or 
- spicy beef ramen or 
- pork rib ramen which I tried today was delicious.  I think I like it better than the Premium pork one. 

Love the broth. The noodles are aldente.  We also get the pork Katsu for the kids on the side

One of our regular lunch spots.   It's not light.  You really want to take a nap after but on a cold day, it's such a yummy lunch for the whole family ;-)
author: Lei H.

description: This is a good place for a quick dinner. It was right by our hotel and we wanted something quick and discovered this place in the food court area of the Westfield mall. Menus have pictures and the food comes out exactly as pictured! The broth is flavorful and the bowl of ramen is really filling. However, the noodles don't have that chewy, al dente texture I like for ramen noodles. They were a bit too soft. Service was minimal but fine for a place that is quick service.
author: Carol C.

description:
I've been here countless times and it's literally my #1 choice to have food every single time I'm in SF! I can't for the life of me understand why it only has a 3.5 star Yelp rating. Everytime I'm in the city I regret it if I go elsewhere. 'Should have gone to Ajisen', is basically the motto of my entire existence for the last year. 

I always get a ramen when I come here, though I have also had the California roll: bomb. 

I pretty much always get a pork ramen of one kind of another because pork. It just goes so well in ramen, dontcha think? I have been careful with the spicy pork ramen because it's like Russian roulette, 1 in 6 will kill you. I say this as a person of Indian origin (via the UK): it's bloody spicy. The last few times it hasn't been as spicy as when I basically needed to make sure I was within close proximity of a bathroom for the next 6 hours after visiting here. Either I've got used to it, or they've toned it down, or it depends who you get making it? But I digress. 

Recently I have become wise to a new trick thanks to my husband. Get the premium pork ramen and ask for a side helping of the spicy pork. This way you get a soup with more than 2 thin slivers of pork plus all the risky goodness of the spicy pork! Who cares about the slight extra cost - the portions are huge, satisfying and the prices are super low, especially considering the uber-central location in the middle of westfield in the middle of san francisco! When do you ever buy a meal in SF and come out thinking 'wow, that was awesome and so cheap'?! 

service is always super friendly and the staff has smiles on their faces. Very obliging, plus fast service. Don't be a dummy and come here at a peak time when yes, you will have to wait a long while outside while you wait for them to call your name. 

It's just an all round good ramen place and I hope it will be here for ever and ever, amen.
author: Zoe L.

description: It's great food done right... Didn't feel like fast food. My absolute favorite item here is the soft beef ramen. The chunks of beef were so tender... MMM... MMM...MMM. I tried a couple other ramen dishes, seafood, sliced beef... But my favorite remain the spicy beef.   You get a good amount of beef and the soup is so good. There might be one in my home town... Excited to try it to see if it's as good as San Francisco...
author: William L.

description:
This Ajisen location is located inside a mall, so my expectations weren't high when coming in, but all in all I found my ramen experience here perfectly average and decent, and the prices very reasonable by Bay Area standards. 

The Ajisen "best combo" ramen, for example, has a number of pieces of meat - whether pork ribs, "premium" pork, and BBQ pork. It costs only $11.50 while most ramen joints here in the West Bay would nickel and dime you for every single add-on. In addition, there are many different types of ramen to choose from, even vegetarian ones, and there are also curry rice dishes, apps like sushi rolls, and sugary Asian tea drinks. 

Service is fast and efficient, and overall this is a decent place for a quick, inexpensive ramen fix.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I love stopping by here whenever I'm shopping in Westfield or Union Square. Honestly, I think this place offers good ramen for its low price. I know it's not the highest quality ramen, but I enjoy their broth and noodles every time I go. 

My go to order is the BBQ pork and corn ramen! I love the crunchy sweet corn with the tender meat all in a tasty broth. :) 

TBH though, I don't venture into their other menu items since I trust their ramen most and haven't truly enjoyed much of their other appetizers, so personally, I always stick with the ramen so my rating only reflects that. 

There is the occasional long wait since the mall tends to be busy (it is SF of course!) but usually I never feel like I wait too long before getting seated. Pro tip: make sure your entire party is there else you won't be seated!
author: Tina T.

description:
Unassuming but surprisingly good ramen from inside Westfield Center!! Ajisen seems to be an international chain but they offer more a more diverse ramen menu than what you typically see in the U.S. Yes, there is the tonkatsu, shoyu and miso you see at other places. But they also offer seafood+pork based broths made with shrimp, curry broths, and various spicy broths. Also the ramen is cheap! Unfortunately I've gotten used to paying $13-$15 for ramen at other places in the Bay... but Ajisen ranges from $9-$12.

I came here with my cousins visiting out of town and really only got to try the Grilled Hokkaido Scallop Ramen - THIS IS REALLY GOOD. I've never had a ramen made with a shrimp+pork broth, but it was really flavorful and savory. The grilled scallops were tasty and the noodles had a good bite to them!  I'm not sure if they make their noodles fresh, but to be honest fresh made noodles are a little overrated. ;)

It was a really well balanced ramen that kept me going that I was able to finish the noodles + the broth. Usually ramen, particularly tonkatsu, can feel rich and heavy in such a way that you get tired of the flavor. I usually have a lot of leftover broth.  In this case, the Hokkaiso Scallop Ramen was addicting to eat! 

We also tried their fried chicken (karaage) which is pretty good. Not too oily and the chicken is moist and flavorful. The breading is a little thick but crispy - it reminded me more of nanban chicken than chicken karaage. Still a good appetizer served with Japanese mayo for dipping.

What a surprise to find a sit down ramen place inside the Westfield Mall! Totally reminds me of ramen places in Japan where they're in food courts or open entry way like a garage. It's next to Panda Express on the bottom floor and has its own designated seating area where you put your name down on the list to be seated. We went around 8 pm on a Saturday and the wait was only like 10 minutes for a table, but I imagine this place can get popular.

So if you're looking for a quick ramen fix near Union Square after shopping, I'd recommend Ajisen for the convenience. It's good ramen, definitely not the best in SF but it's good and cheap. Also you don't have to wait outside in the cold for a seat... unlike some places in the city.
author: Alyanna C.

description:
TLDR: Good ramen place if you are just craving ramen and don't want to shell out $$ for a bowl of ramen. Or, you just happen to be at the mall.

I been to other Ajisen Ramen chains many times before and I always order the same thing. This particular location is located on the basement floor of the Westfield mall (the same floor as the food court).

I get the Ajisen Ramen because it's the most affordable and it tastes just as good as the other types of ramen in my opinion. The broth is rich, but not as rich as the ramen broths that have been brewing for an entire day. I love adding the chili powder in my ramen. It adds a great flavor and isn't very spicy. You have to either ask for the powder or get it yourself near the side of the restaurant.
author: Jamie N.

description: Okay, so I generally never eat at mall food court - probably because I don't go to the mall that much and when I do, I go where i need and then leave.  I don't like malls but I was at the Westfield SFO because I wanted to go to Zara, currently PDX doesn't have one, but they are building one, and I had just flown in, and was hungry, and LOVE ramen.  So, I stumbled upon Ajisen and was really pleasantly surprised. First off, and please don't take this the wrong way, but when I see a lot of people of the same culture and ethnicity eating at a place that is serving that type of food, I always assume it's traditional and good.  And this place was - i had the tofu ramen which was lovely, although I could use a bit more broth but that's me and the pork gyoza.  Both were steaming hot and delicious.  Not to mention the tea - i don't know what type it was and wish I had asked - smelled like gardenia although didn't taste like gardenia.  It was so lovely and just made me feel so calm and centered.  All in all, i really enjoyed Ajisen.  And the staff was very attentive and sweet.  I felt sorry for my waiter because of group of unruly, ill behaved and I'll say privileged American teenagers came in as I was eating and were not being respectful to those dining around them or the the waiter.  He took it all in stride and never stopped smiling.  I even said something to him because their behavior was really atrocious, and he smiled and said "they will learn".  I was really impressed by that and all in all a nice mall lunch experience.
author: Lauren A P.

description:
After a day of shopping in Westfield, I made my way down to the bottom level for some grub. Shopping gets pretty intense so I'm always excited to check out the many food options this food court has to offer. After spending some time looking at menus, I settled on this place. For some reason, ramen was what my taste buds were craving. 

When you approach the stand you write your name on the clipboard and then a server will call you when your table is ready. Fortunately, it seemed like either the staff was super efficient or it wasn't as busy because the minute I wrote my name, I was sat. Lots of tables in the place and at first, lots of people but as my time there continued, I ended being one of two tables. The staff was cool; nothing out of the ordinary. They were prompt, partly due to not having a ton of tables so that was appreciated. 

For my meal, I got the Shoyu Ramen for $9.75. Soaked in shoyu broth, you have the ramen noodles, bamboo shoots, fish cake, nori, soy soaked egg, chashu and green onions. The shoyu broth fell a little flat for me and the noodles were borderline hard. My dish came extremely fast so that might have been the problem. The egg was a big let down; I appreciate more of a soft boiled egg as opposed to the overcooked half I received. I didn't know what to expect in a mall food court however Westfield is known for great dining options. Unfortunately this dish didn't live up in my opinion. 

It's not that I wouldn't return to this place however with many other options in the mall, it's hard to say that I would prioritize my next visit here. Maybe next time, I'll get a few dishes to compare the experience.
author: Rockne H.

description: Ajisen Ramen is a great option for a quick ramen craving fix located in the mall.  I came close to closing time but was still able to order.  I was told though that they will be closing soon.  The ramen was a pretty generous portion and the flavor was good.  I ordered a bubble tea and it was pretty good. There is a pretty large dining area for Ajisen Ramen.  You still have to order from the counter but the staff will bring out your order when it's ready.  I felt it was pretty reasonably priced.  They had a pretty large menu as well including some appetizers/small plates.  I would definitely return if I'm in this mall.
author: Esther K.

description:
Recommend donkatsu here! Rolls are just okay.. wont order again.
Visited Westfield location, always busy and friendly staffs.
author: Sunmin C.

description:
Rainy day and had to go to the city to run last minute errands. My sister said that this was her favorite ramen place in the city. I know, food court?  But seriously it was so good. Ajisen Best Combo Ramen Tender pork ribs/Premium Pork/BBQ pork in a curry-pork base (yes, curry. It makes a difference) $12.95 Fried tofu $3.25 Gyoza $4.25 #QuoteFromMenu #lastvacationmeal #illmissallthefood #askforcurry .
#Hungry #AlwaysHungry713  #FeedMe #ITakePicturesOfFood #Foodie #TakenByIPhone #FoodGram #EatLocal #Sfeats #eatsf #EatThis #IGFoods #sanfrancisco #ajisenramen #westfieldmall #ajisenramen
author: Dee d.

description:
Ajisen used to be good
So this time, thought you would 
But was a disappointed this time around
Tasted the ajisen ramen and it made me frown

Should have been tastier, should have been great
But alas, my ramen appetite this did not satiate. 

Been to another branch and thought this one would be good.  But eh. It was so so. The popcorn chicken was really good though but the ramen wasn't that great. Noodles were ok and the broth wasn't as rich or tasty as a premium ramen place should be.
author: Dennis K.

description:
We wanted ramen and we got RAMEN! Seriously the best ramen I've ever had! I'm comparing to my favorite ramen in San Diego (Tajima). The "Volcano Ramen" was delicious and spicy, the fried chicken appetizer was delicious served with a mix of mayo. The service is also great but either way the food was amazing, to add this place is inside of a mall!! Never had good food like this in any mall. It's on the 1st floor, near champs sports. 

I'm only here for the weekend visiting and I wish they had delivery to my hotel room! Lol

Thai tea and other drinks are buy one get one FREE
author: Joseph M.

description: Overall delicious ramens served. The broth(s) they use for their ramen is so flavorful!Reasonably prices and good service too! Can't wait to go back!
author: Stella G.

description:
ABC Ramen combo is my go to here along with the gyoza. BEST COMBINATION.

The rest of the ramen types here were lacking but the service is great and cant beat the ABC combo especially considering it's a chain restaurant.

I like this place for a mall ramen location + awesome customer service = 4 stars
author: AQ N.

description:
So far so good! my favorite place to have some RAMEN the price is worth it and the food its really good...
I might going back here again to have some good RAMEN
author: Camelle Mae S.

description:
If you want a quick ramen that's cheap and fast this place is good to consider. 

Not much depth of flavor in the broth (I got the Ajisen Ramen). I prefer a soft boiled egg with a runny yolk, they only have hard boiled. The pork slices are tougher than usual and don't melt in your mouth. 

Definitely a franchise ramen place and not the typical gourmet styles.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Love me some ramen! Grabbed a quick lunch here while in San Fran. I got the ajisen best ramen and couldn't resist the spicy tuna on the side. The ramen was solid. Good broth and flavor. But..what earned the 4 stars was that spicy tuna. It was outstanding. Nice and spicy and the texture was great, you could tell it was nice grade tuna. If you're in the area I say check this place out. I had a short wait for a table but the service was quick and efficient.
author: Melissa H.

description: The service we received from Ibraham was excellent! Food came out on time and delicious as expected! Ty
author: Drake S.

description:
Best ramen!!! After reading some reviews I had to try this place for myself.

Location: This place is located in the mall's good court. Extra loud and crowded in this area to eat. This place seriously needs it's own restaurant location. I hate sitting elbow to elbow with the person next to me. I noticed this theme in most small SF restaurants here.

Food: Spicy pork and Spicy Miso Pork ramens were both to die for!!!! I will make sure I eat here everytime I come to SF.

Service: Quick, non-friendly

I will return as long as the food quality remains.
author: Linda H.

description:
Found in the food court at Westfield, it's pretty much a ramen place that you would expect to find in a food court... A pretty long line for a weekend lunch, not quite sure why I decided to come here. I guess it's just an easier place to get ramen if you're already hanging out downtown. 

FOOD:
I got the premium pork ramen which was generally underwhelming. Noodles okay, while the broth was decently flavorful. Pork simply okay. A little dry; definitely not premium. Unfortunately there was a hair in my soup, which was disappointing, but they did replace it and comp a drink. 

Honestly not worth it to come here. There are so many other really good ramen places in the city, and way better eats downtown. There's a wait for mediocre food, that's not ultra cheap. I can't find a reason for me to come back besides being in dire need of ramen and I somehow can't leave Westfield.
author: Bryant C.

description: Ordered tan tan men, best combo ramen, California roll with masago and 2 iced teas. Overall I would say is a pretty good place to go for ramen, but I wouldn't order tan tan men. There wasn't as much meat in the soup. My favorite is the California roll with masago, it might be because I have a soft spot for masago but man it hit the spot.
author: Nina Y.

description:
This place isn't as good as used to be when it first opened a while back.

My colleague and I came here after work to grab something warm and soupy.  Maybe they didn't season it enough, but the tonkotsu broth was unbearably bland.  However, the pork belly made up for the lack of flavoring in the broth, as it was rich, flavorful, and it melted in my mouth.

The calamari, fried chicken, and wait staff service were on point though.

3 stars for food
1 star for service
author: Dustin W.

description: Standard ramen joint, great for a quick fix, but found the broth to be a bit salty. Great options for toppings, but overall it's just decent.
author: Kevin N.

description:
If you thought that you couldn't get good ramen in the mall, Ajisen Ramen just proved you wrong.

Their authentic white tonkatsu broth is made the traditional way: slowly boiling pork bones and pork fat until the marrow melts into the broth. Ramen is a trendy dish these days, but Ajisen manages to do it right. I've been to Ajisen location in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Shanghai, and Singapore, and the experience has been universally positive.

On my most recent visit, I ordered the Ajisen Best Combo Ramen, which is a solid standby composed of various kinds of pork. I strongly recommend that you try the Tontoro Ramen, which also features a big slab of pork, however, its pork belly has a sweet glaze that uniquely compliments the more salty and savory broth. I also ordered the seaweed salad, which was conventional but quite tasty, and I also got an iced Honey Citron, which is a Korean analogue of half-and-half or sweet tea, but with more of a sweet orange flavor. If you haven't had Honey Citron, Ajisen is a great place to try it.
author: Cameron N.

description:
Food was alright, a bit overly salty, don't see anything special about this place at all. Wait time was pretty long, but that's to be expected from a mall. It may seem cheap to the eye, but the tips! Mandatory tips ended up to be 20% and we paid that in cash, but then they took the cash AND took it from the card we paid with! Never told us either!

Update: We went up to them and requested them to return the cash tips to us, of which they did, but with attitude. They still do have mandatory 20% tips, but hey, at least we paid $17 instead of $34 of tips!
author: Queenie C.

description:
Decent ramen considering its at the mall. I got the premium pork ramen. Pork was thinly sliced and pretty good. Broth was ok, a bit on the bland rather than salty side and a little watery but it was still flavorful enough for me. I asked for chili on the side to give it more flavor. Noodles were nothing remarkable. I tried the fried calamari and the picture on the menu shows that it is not battered in panko but it comes out with fried batter. Regardless, it was still pretty good. I tried some of the dynamite volcano ramen and the broth was pretty bland just super super spicy. 

Overall- decent ramen and I might return if at the mall again.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Ajisen Ramen, located within the bottom floor of the Westfield Shopping Center, is a wonderful spot for all different types of ramen!

I came here to grab dinner with a friend after work on a Friday night and enjoyed the meal very much. I don't recall exactly which ramen I ordered, but I do remember enjoying the creamy broth and chewy noodles. The chashu meat is well made in that it is juicy in flavor and not tough at all.

One thing about this Ajisen Ramen though is that everything happens super quick. After being seated, we made our orders soon after and the food came out in just a couple of minutes. It seems that they want a fast turnover too as the bill came as soon as we finished. It makes sense as the mall gets busy on a Friday night with lots of people waiting for seats, but it's something to keep in mind.
author: Joshua M.

description:
It is worth a try, prices are reasonable. I travel around the bay searching for the best ramen. This is probably rated somewhere in the top half of what I've tried... the ramen I got was not extremely satisfying even though it is 'good', so I feel I need to come back and try a different bowl. 

I got the "Ajisen best ramen" (with 3 types of pork). Smells delicious, the broth is good. The meat was not very warm (so I let it sit longer in the broth)... although the meat was pretty soft. There was something about the noodles that didn't taste right texture-wise, but it's hard to describe.

Our waitress was very nice and attentive. The two drinks we got were quite sugary at base level (iced milk tea and iced Thai tea, no boba). 

I would visit again. My current top ramen place, should you want to compare, is Santouka Ramen in San Jose.
author: Adele R.

description:
It's pretty good! We got a peace passion soda and it's pretty refreshing!

The combo ramen is good for anyone who's indecisive and this is the best one to pick!
author: Life W.

description:
Everytime I've been here there is always a wait. This place has average tasting ramen, but the location is too convenient to pass up. 

I ordered the tonkatsu ramen with corn. It came with plenty of noodles, corn, and half an egg. If you're really hungry the portion size is plenty filling. 

The corn didn't go well with the ramen cause it tasted too sweet. The pork chashu was too tough. Noodles are very chewy, but don't really taste like ramen noodles. 

Overall, it was okay. If you have a craving for good ramen, this won't satisfy it.
author: Edward W.

description:
I thought it was pretty good ramen especially for being a mall food court spot. 
The drinks are what really won me here. The yogurt green tea and the smoothies are something's I'm going to be craving for a while!
author: Christie S.

description: We were wandering the mall when the kids asked for ramen.   We walked by this place and it was full, so we decided to put our name down to try it out.  The service was good.  The wait wasn't bad at all as the servers were very quick and efficient.  The food was mediocre.  We ordered the pork ramens and one fried chicken ramen.  It was good for a quick easy dinner but not a place I'd head back to for a ramen craving.
author: Viv I.

description:
I treated myself to a bowl of ramen last night after a successful shopping trip at the mall. I wasn't sure what to make of Ajisen, given that it's located in the food court, but I was pleased to see that they had an extensive menu and table service. It definitely felt more like a restaurant than a food stall. There were so many different types of ramen to choose from and my server helped me pick one. I went for the summer ramen, which is basically a spicy miso. The ramen came very quickly and had cabbage, seaweed, a half egg, four pieces of pork, green onion, and a big ball of spciy paste to mix in.

The broth was creamy and flavorful, and the noodles al dente. It was a really good portion, and a great price ($9.75!). All of the toppings were super tasty, and I thought there was a generous amount of pork. I was happy to see a lot of other single diners around me, and I didn't feel weird pulling out a book. I finished every last drop of ramen and was extremely satisfied. 

I would definitely seek this ramen out again!!
author: Regina L.

description:
I have been here 3 times and it was always delicious. I order the vegetarian ramen and it's to die for. Only once, when it was absolutely packed did the ramen not cook that well but all in all taste is excellent. 
Update: I'm a regular now. They're fast. They're clean. The ramen is truly delicious.
author: Andre N.

description:
We descended upon Westfield Shopping Center before we head out to the ice skating rink in Union Square. A quick Yelp search led us to Ajisen Ramen at the basement food court. Ah, nothing like a hot ramen on a cold winter day. Ajisen Ramen was packed as it was the weekend but we did not wait too long until we were seated. Mind you; grabbing a seat just outside of the restaurant will not yield you restaurant service and orders need to be asked to go.

Ajisen has numerous selection of ramen. I decided to try their Spicy Pork ramen. The rest of my group selected the same or a close iteration of the Tonkotsu ramen.  Big props to Ajisen, as the Spicy Pork is properly packed with heat. The broth is good and the noodles were cooked alright. I do like that their Karaage chicken nuggets, which Abigail as always loves, are made from dark meat ~ mmm, yummier. 

I am glad to see that they also have a branch in Fremont and would like to try out different style ramen. This inquisition for Ajisen Ramen will let me park the stars at 4 for now. It is not the best ramen I have tasted but we all did enjoy ours at Ajisen SoMA.
author: Paul V.

description:
Haven't been here in ages like years!!!

Ramen still just as good as I remember.  Still my go to place in SF.  There is a promotion for buy one drink get one free.
author: roger t.

description:
If you're at the mall or in the area this is a great place for ramen. I'm taking a star off because the noodles were more like spaghetti noodles than traditional ramen noodles. Other than that everything was good. 

When you arrive you write your name and number of people dining on a notepad and then when there is a table they call your name. The service was fast and the server was friendly. 

I got the spicy pork ramen and it was delicious. At first the spice level wasn't as spicy so I ordered a side of their volcano sauce and that was PERFECT. I don't really like siracha as a sauce in ramen so it was great they had the volcano sauce. 

The menu also gad a variety of items. They offered different broths and they also had vegetarian options. There were also some appetizers and a ton of drink options from boba to your regular foundation drinks. 

I would definitely return!
author: Andrea R.

description:
Surprisingly food great for a fast food in shopping mall .
Nice and very clean , fast service not very friendly staff but may be they're very busy . We Ordered tan- tan Ramon was spicy and beef Ramon , both very delicious and fresh .
author: payam b.

description: The male server here has a major attitude problem. Noodles were hard and soup was bland. Won't be coming back here again.
author: Ray Z.

description: My worst experience. First of all, the server wasn't friendly at all. And also got my drink wrong, ordered diet coke, got a sprite, told the waiter and he said he will check the order, got a diet coke after 5 minutes, tasted really watery, and found out something was floating. I told the waiter and he said oh, and took away the drink. Okay where is my apology? Seriously, worst service ever. The food didnt even look sanitary as well. Oh wells, never again.
author: Yoon Ah J.

description: Completely reasonable, tasty ramen. Is it world-class? No. Is it impressive for being a mall food court? Yeah, most definitely yes. It's a solid choice amongst the mall food court options, though I don't see myself making a special trip to the mall to eat here.
author: Sean B.

description:
It's the best Baby clams ramen soup that I tried.  I'm so pleased with this places . 
The service is fantastic and fast.
author: Grecia N.

description: Spicy pork ramen has the right amount of spice. There is too much flour on the fried chicken. Decent ramen.
author: Hans H.

description:
Visited here on Sunday for lunch (around noon).
Sitted quickly after 5 min. of waiting.
The service was decent. I didn't really have anything to complain from this visit.
I got a pork combo ramen. I would say the ramen was pretty good. Not greasy at all! Pork ramen could be really greasy if not made well. But they managed to make it tasty. I wouldn't say their ramen was super amazing, but not too bad. I would come here again when I crave for ramen while shopping neae Westfield.
author: Denny C.

description:
EVENT: Getting some of my steps down on my fitbit - walking around the mall. It was almost hard to find... but it's right next to Panda Express.... or a few more stores down from Jamba Juice... you're close!

SERVICE: Very quick service. Don't forget to put your name on the waitlist! This is very useful during lunch time. The service is fast! They clean tables very quickly and they sit you down almost immediately. Water comes out when you're given a menu. Waiter comes back quickly to order your meal. 4 stars to service!

Here's what we got:
(1) Fried Chicken - squeeze a some lemon... and dip it in mayo sauce... dude... delish! Crunchy and... be careful when you bite into it! It's hot! Fresh from the frier! 4 stars!
(2) Volcano Pork Ramen - couple slices of pork, nice medium-thick round yellow noodles, mushrooms, and the volcano spice - mix it up... and gives you a little kick! Not super spicy... just a little kick. 4 stars!
(3) Special Pork Ramen - looks like some shredded pieces of deep-fried pork - similar broth and ingredients, but minus the volcano spice. Delish! 4 stars!

**OVERAL - totally come back for the volcano ramen! 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Did they seriously just serve me spaghetti noodles in broth? Did I also just wait 30 minutes for this?

Crowded. Horrible quality. Dirty.
author: Kevin C.

description:
For something you find in a mall food court, I have to say this Ramen joint is pretty decent. I ordered their spicy beef ramen and was reasonably pleased with the soup. It was spicy, yet flavorful and the noodles were firm and chewy--just the way I like them. 

I also ordered their green milk tea, but I did find it a little too sweet and artificial for my liking. 

Not a bad place if you're just taking a break from your shopping!
author: Allison T.

description: Pleasantly surprised. Ramen spot in westfield mall was so good! Anytime I'm at the mall i will probably go here. Wait wasn't too long. Prices were reasonable and they have a variety of foods to choose from.
author: Lena M.

description: The organic ramen with tofu was so delicious I decided to make it spicy. If you check in yelp you get a buy one get one free Thai tea. I also got the dragon roll sushi. I would love to come here again.
author: Maria B.

description: This is the best ramen place I have eatin in SF this place is really nice the servers here are a little rude to my friends but my server was awesome prices are not bad food was amazing
author: Lionel K.

description: My favorite Japanese ramen place in Bay Area so far. But l am disappointed this time because I ordered spicy pork ramen. The waitress got the wrong ramen and I had to wait longer. Plus the ramen had spicy sauce which was gochujang (Korean pepper pace). Honestly the ramen tasted not that great because it taste like half Korean food. And that's not what I came for. It just didn't make sense and didn't taste good.
author: Yoojin K.

description: Ordered Premier Pork Ramen, came with older pork as picture, harder and not much flavor. The location decided their always busier business. How about quality? giving two stars is because the juice is not bad.
author: Shrabbit A.

description: Love the food, if you like Ramen, then This is the stop. Every time I'm in San Francisco I stop by Ajisen Ramen for lunch. You should check it out!!
author: Steve M.

description:
In 2011, while working in Macau, I would take a weekly day trip into Zhuhai. Before crossing the border again one of the few places I could really look forward to eating was Ajisen ramen. 

I was thrilled to see it pop up on a search for Ramen.
This place literally blows Katana-ya out of the water. 

My recommendations:
Spicy ground pork ramen
Tan tan mien 
Spicy beef, add spicy pork :)

It's  $1.75 to add extra pork, and $1.50 for an egg, totally worth it. The spice is perfect, yeah   noodles could be better,  but for the worldwide consistency they provide its more than acceptable. 

Service is like China, you cannot complain because it's extremely efficient. I am never disappointed
author: Sri P.

description: The New York steak cutlet ramen pretty good! And the ajisen comb ramen is good too...
author: Ben W.

description:
This place is accurately 3.5 stars. 

It has amazing variety and the ramen was solid overall.  Great meat portions, soup was pretty flavorful. The main weakness was the ramen noodles, it was not as chewy as I hoped a bit soft. But overall for $10-$12 it's a bang for your buck. 
Located in downtown in the mall this place was the only option open early in the morning and really hit the spot for my hangover.

I hate when ramen places skimp out on meat, this place definitely had that base covered
author: Travis L.

description: Not bad for a mall resto, food came quick and service was good. Fried chicken appetizer was good. Spicy ramen is actually spicy, and dan dan men was also spicy. Standard ramen options, menu isn't too fussy but there are some alternatives such as katsu. Portions are a good size.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE fix your togo order situation!!! The lid isn't even a real lid and there was one piece of tape on it?! The broth spilled all over my groceries and ruined my shopping items!!

SOUP SHOULD NOT BE PLACED INTO PAPER BAGS!!! Why is plastic not an option??

Not only did it ruin everything in my bags, I also lost half my broth. 

Fix this problem so nobody else has to experience my misery.
author: Dennis A.

description: Great food and wonderful service.  We are there quite often... but the food is so good, and so rich, it's beginning to show in my waistline (the only downside).  Highly recommended for Ramen in the Fremont area!
author: Avanish V.

description: After a fun day of shopping and a movie, my friend and I tried this ramen place at the food court of Westfield Shopping Center. She had the scallops ramen and I had the pork ramen. We were both very satisfied with our choices as our noodle soups were flavorful and perfect for a cold rainy day. The service here is fast and casual. The food is affordable too. I would definitely go back here when I'm craving ramen noodles and when I happen to be in Westfield. For a food court fast food restaurant, this one is good!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
For mall food this place is 4 stars. I stopped in here for a $9.75 bowl of shoyu ramen. Overall flavor was good, but it was a little lacking in meat and condiments. Also go the spicy tuna mix, which was decent and spicy.

Compared to some of the food court food I had a while back, this was a solid snack during the day. Wouldn't suggest this for dinner or any heavier meal.
author: James S.

description:
The ramen here is far from authentic Japanese ramen (I think this place is a part of a Taiwanese chain) but I like it a lot. 

You get a whole lot more for your money here compared to a real Japanese ramen place. Japanese ramen places usually give you like less than three bites of protein and charge you $15. I guess this is okay for women or petite feminine men but not for real men who need a normal amount of food. I can understand that this is normal in Japan since their live stock is limited over there. However in the US meat is plentiful yet Japanese places still give you as less protein as possible. 

Ajisen gives you, I would guess, 8 times more protein than a typical Japanese ramen place. They are also really quick with getting your food out. I think the ramen taste pretty good too.
author: Scott T.

description:
I am not even reluctant to admit this chain ramen shop at a shopping mall is wayy better than Katana-Ya and the others in Japantown, sadly.

After you shop til you drop, Ajisen Ramen will give you strength to get back on your feet and keep going. So far, they have been successful at fulfilling my ramen cravings, whenever I am in this area.

Are they the best ramen shop in SF? No, but they are surprisingly better than many. I usually order the Ajisen Combo, which has three different kinds of pork... because this girl loves meat! Is their pork the most tender and delicious? It varies time to time, but not bad at all! Although the tonkotsu broth is a little bit on the salty side sometimes, it hits the spot at most times.

Pros:
-Service, fast and efficient
-Convenience of location
-You can order to go (and "skip the line")
-Reasonable price

Cons:
-No default egg in the Ajisen Combo
-The line (goes pretty fast though)

Recommended? Yes, to nourish yourself during your shopping sessions or lunch breaks.
author: Solongo B.

description:
SURPRISINGLY GOOD. Came here very hungry on a Tuesday afternoon after strolling around the centre and let's just say I was stupefied! I am a skeptic of the quality of mall food court ramen but this idea was debunked by Ajisen Ramen, hooray!

Food: Ordered the Spicy Pork Ramen to share with my boyfriend along with the Fried Tofu. Super affordable, with most bowls ranging from $8-$12 a bowl. The quantities given were pretty big, and my boyfriend and I left with our tummies happily filled (he was not as hungry as me but if he was we probably would've ordered 2 bowls). The ramen had a good amount of heat in it, just enough to make it enjoyable but not to the point where your nose is dripping or anything. Broth is good, but I liked the pork in whole pieces instead of ground up (less appealing to eat). I was happy that there was an egg in the ramen, but it was boiled to the point where the yolk was dry and unappealing to eat (Orenchi's half boiled eggs are my favorite). The fried tofu was pretty average, I didn't really like the breading as it was pretty dry, but my boyfriend enjoyed it. Decently sized (2) pieces were given to us.

Ambience: Felt a little weird that it felt like a restaurant but also like a to-go place. The wait was nothing on a weekday afternoon, and the food came out in 5 minutes (I timed it!) Servers were nice, although I felt like they were a little frantic because it was somewhat busy. 

Overall I would definitely eat here again if I was in the area and hungry for a quick bite. I was originally gonna go towards Chipotle which is is next door but I thought I'd give this place a-go, try it yourself too!
author: Bonnie T.

description: I just recently discovered and finally tried Ajisen Ramen and have enjoyed enough to go back three times in the past couple of weeks.  I've tried so far, the combo ramen with three different porks, ramen with fried chicken and a plain bowl of ramen w/miso broth and a side order of gyoza. All have been pretty good but was quite disappointed with the gyoza as they are pretty small, bite size dumplings and you get 4 in an order. Service is excellent and always friendly/helpful. This is my go to now when I want a decent hot lunch. Will definitely become a regular here. They also have rice plates if you're not in the mood for ramen, will be trying one of those next on my next visit.
author: Kim L.

description: The pork cutlet with curry rice is awesome. The combo ramen was good. Fast service. They did not refill the drinks though.
author: Iamme S.

description: Ajisen offers decent ramen for a decent price -- you get what you pay for. Their menu has a good variety of different flavors of ramen. The place is usually pretty full but the wait isn't too long. If you're shopping in Westfield and get hungry, I would definitely recommend trying Ajisen at least once!
author: Yangzi H.

description: I actually don't hate this place. I think they have a pretty good ramen. Why i give 3 star is that, my friend order a fried chicken ramen. It's a ramen with soup with a fried chicken on the side. The ramen come after 10 minutes, which is good. But the chicken doesn't come like 10 minute after the noodle come. It's frustrating because the ramen is plain without the fried chicken. And noodle with broth should be seated for too long because the noodle will expand. We saw the fried chicken in the counter and then they gave it too someone else.
author: Catherine S.

description: I had bought a ramen and drink because it's buy one get one free with a check in. The drink wasn't that good I didn't drink too much of it. It was super sweet and bitter. I got the strawberry tea or something. The ramen was super good and they don't split bills. They also aren't comfortable with people bringing food from the outside in which is understandable. The ramen was pretty good I must say.
author: Esther M.

description: Drinks are normal taste, I don't like the pork, it has little bit pig taste. Noodle texture is good, love the soup base. Service is fast. Over will come back again.
author: Qing L.

description:
This seemed like one of the cooler food court offerings at the Westfield. Interestingly enough, there was a waitlist, and your server brings you the food, like at a typical sit-down restaurant. I can't think of any other Westfield eatery that has that sit-down service. 

From the outside, you can't really see the menu board, and they had no menus out in front for you to look at. You just have to take a chance, not knowing specifically what their menu items were. I put my name on the waitlist, and there were about 3 parties ahead of me. The wait didn't seem all that long, since a few people left while we were waiting. 

Service was very mediocre, at least towards us. The servers seemed robotic and uninterested. It seemed the tall, pretty guy server and the tall, pretty girl at the counter were both shallow plastic-surgery types. I don't think they'd care for customers unless they fit their same aspirational vibe. I didn't dare ask any questions about the menu items because this seemed to be the type of place where they know even less about the food than you do. So I just took a leap and ordered what looked interesting, and what I felt like eating at that moment - pork and corn ramen. 

I've definitely had better Japanese ramen. The salty broth was fairly good, but still seemed a bit off. The portions looked very big, but I was able to finish it all, and it was a good portion for dinner. My bowl had pieces of pork and veggies. The pork was pretty good, though not spectacular, and the hard boiled egg and veggies were ok. I thought my drink was supposed to have boba, but there was no boba in there. I asked the waiter about it, and he just mumbled something in a rude, uncaring way. The waiters seem very confused and lacking in diligence and intelligence. It made sense, because the guy was very pretty, and so was the tall girl behind the counter. 

After we put cash in the black guest check holder, the pretty waiter didn't come for a long time. I think we were so off his radar, he just didn't care and totally forgot. I saw him just sitting at a seat nearby, playing with his iPhone X or whatever, probably texting a girlfriend. Finally, I flagged down another employee, who didn't seem very happy to interact with me. She brought the guest book to the counter. Then we waited a long time, and nothing happened. Weren't they supposed to bring the guest book back so we can take the receipt? We had put in cash, including tip, and we had written that on the receipt. Finally, we asked that same employee, and she took a look again and consulted with the pretty girl at the counter, who gave us a less-than-pleasant look. The employee came back and said something like we paid in cash, and left a tip already, so there was nothing more to do. She asked if we wanted the receipt, and we said yes. Geez. Talk about really clueless, inattentive service. 

And this is the part that made me give this 1 star, instead of the 2 stars I'd otherwise give it: Shortly after I ate the noodles, I had an upset stomach. It became really bad later in the night - I had pretty severe stomach pains. I had to take Pepto Bismol-type medication. There was something really bad, expired, or unclean in the noodles I had. I am definitely never going back there again, and I'm telling everyone I know about that, too. 

Ambiance: 2/5
Service: 1.5/5
Food (taste): 3/5
Food (quality/safety/cleaniness): negative stars - severe upset stomach, needed to take meds
author: S F.

description: One of my favorite ramen place. I like the Spicy Miso Ramen., spicy and tasty. The egg was cooked perfectly. I wish they have combo menu, ex; ramen with 1 side dish or sushi, would be great. Service fast and friendly.
author: Maria S.

description: I really like their spicy pork ramen, the taste is super good. I wait my ramen just 5 to 10 minutes. Service is good
author: Davka D.

description:
Even after a five-month ramen drought, I would still consider this just average ramen. The main thing it has going for it is the location - what else sounds better than a hot bowl of noodle soup after a morning of winter shopping? Anyways, this place doesn't seem to slow down much even after the lunch hour, which means that although you might be seated quickly, you're in for a wait on all other fronts. 

The tables are squished together for maximum people:space ratio. Don't feel bad about accidentally eavesdropping because others are probably doing the same to you! The huge menu is not nearly as daunting when you realize that at least 75% of the pages are dedicated to helpful pictures. 

We started off with the Fried Tofu appetizer, which came out piping hot. Crisp on the outside, with a dishful of ginger shavings. Would order again... except that each cube cost over $1. I went with the Corn & BBQ Pork Ramen, while Jiwon M. got the Pork Rib Ramen. The first thing that stood out was how tender and fatty the meat was - a thumbs up for the protein! The broth was underwhelming, savory but not quite the pork or miso taste I was expecting (although the Pork Rib broth was better). I also wished they replaced the cabbage in the soup with seaweed or something with more umami flavor. On the plus side though, the soup wasn't too salty. The noodles were thicker and softer than I'm used to, but not bad, and I was grateful for the mini ladle (because a spoon is not adequate) provided. 

Portion sizes are good, but $10+ is still a lot to pay for average ramen. It took forever to finish paying for our meal, but the waitresses remained polite in spite of the busy-ness. Would lean towards one of the many other ramen shops in the city unless it's peak pricing for Uber/Lyft.
author: Helen S.

description:
Excellent Ramen and Service.  Arisen Ramen was recommended to us when we were in LA and we like it.  Now, we just discovered that there is an Ajisen Ramen inside the Westfield Shopping Mall in San Francisco.  The restaurant is located in the food court...bottom floor.  The place is not big so there was a waiting list to be seated.  The whole time were were there, there was a line.  Food was as good as what we had in LA.  A+ for consistency.  

If you're a beginner in Ramen, you may want to start with the Fried Chicken Ramen.  You get the Ramen Soup plus a side of Fried Chicken (Karaage). My wife and kids would order the Spicy Pork Ramen and Spicy Beef Ramen...both very good as well.

Service was great.  We were seated in about 5min and we were the 4th party on the list.  They don't check up on you as much, but probably because they're very busy.  However, if you needed something, you can get their attention and they were always helpful.

As for parking, well, there is a parking garage next to the mall.  Of course, it's not free.  

We will definitely come back.
author: Alvin C.

description:
VOLCANO RAMEN IS REALLY HOT! (In my opinion) that being said, onto the review:

I've been here various times for a quick ramen fix before catching Bart. They use thin tubular noodles that are different than your usual ramen noodle, but it's decent. I've tried a lot of their ramen types, refer to the pictures, and they were all decent in flavour. HOWEVER, the noodle portions are small. I eat a lot of better ramen back home so this ramen was tasty, but too little! I needed a lot more noodle.. Maybe you can pay for more but if they're going to charge you for the amount they do, average $8-9, they better be giving you enough noodles. I remember the last shoyu ramen I had here I finished in like 6 bites and I eat slow.

Appetizers:
California roll is pretty good for something in the mall but a bit pricey in my opinion.
Croquette is tasty! If you've never had one I recommend trying this.

Drinks are pretty great. Peach green tea has chunks of peach in it and their boba is cooked perfectly.
author: Bianca M.

description: This mall food stop offers a great selection of ramen, small plates and flavored teas. The premium pork ramen, fried oysters and mango ice tea are my go-to order here. Service is slow but it's a good value.
author: Andrew S.

description: Found this little place because it  was the closest ramen after the women's march. We tried the baby octopus, ramen, and Thai tea. Very cozy place, but the ramen portions were pretty small and a tiny bit under-seasoned. Not bad though! Great for mall ramen and a quick bite.
author: Kamryn K.

description: The brand was originally from mainland China. It's a fast food ramen chain with reasonable price and ordinary taste. Recommend the pork soup but if you are a vegan, you can hv their mixed green ramen.
author: Chun J.

description: This place is great for a quick lunch. We love their spicy beef ramen and California rolls. Even during their busy times on weekends, service is prompt. We come back regularly because of their convenient location within Westfield mall.
author: Kartini M.

description:
This place was conveniently placed at the end of our B.A.R.T trip to Westfield mall. Was dying of starvation and hunger and ectastic to see a ramen spot, my Achilles' tendon. 

Ordered the spicy beef with extra pork and extra bamboo shoot. Had 1 pepper for level of spicyness and it was pretty accurate; not too spicy but still made me sweat a little bit but not waaaay to spicy where it will burn a hole in your stomach. The beef could have been more tender but not overcooked by too much. The broth was creamy and warmed my tummy just right. Not bad for fast ramen. Our order came out within 10-15 minutes. 

Also ordered the cranberry mango lychee drink which wasn't too sweet. You can taste each ingredient within the drink. 

Finally had the potato croquette. Crispy and soft on the inside served with a dipping, a side of mayo.
author: A Z Flor H.

description: I always get the pork miso ramen. It's really good!Since there is usually a line,  l like to order ahead and they always get it right! I am a fan!
author: Marie F.

description: I'd give 3.5 stars if that was an option. While I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for ramen, I will definitely go back when I happen to be at Westfield. This is a big step up from food court ramen and a pleasant surprise-flavorful and generous portion size albeit I found the pork to be a little over salted for my taste. Very nice servers too. If you can't find it, note that it's right below Nordstrom, not in the regular food court area.
author: R S.

description:
I understand we came at a busy time, but I know we've definitely had better service.

On normal visits, I would give this place 3 or 4 stars.

Milk Green Tea $3.25
(better than starbucks iced green tea latte in my opinion!)
Miso Ramen with BBQ Pork $9.75
(3.5/5.. needs more pork.)

Also, although not their fault a bum went walking through with feces on his shoes, I was disappointed and disgusted with their method of using straight mop on it and then dragging the mop down the whole walkway to clean it.  Shouldn't need training on that part =\
author: Sandy S.

description:
I've been coming to Westfield for years and never had a chance to try it because the long lines during peak eating times always discouraged me. The day finally came when it was just about to be lunch time, I was hungry, they were already open, and there was no line!

Poor bf got dragged into Ajisen. I guess this could be considered part of my Ramen Run 2K17. Together, we ordered the Ajisen Ramen, the Premium Pork Ramen and the chicken kaarage. I didn't have super high hopes for this place. After all, it is located in a mall food court, but I still wanted to try it. The broth for both of our bowls were very bland, not much flavor. The chicken was crispy and came out hot. The cherry on top of this whole experience was that this place was severely understaffed. They only had 1 server for all the different tables, and was running around like a chicken with her head cut off. Ajisen should have known better. On weekends, there are always extremely long lines, please put more staff on the floor. It seemed to take forever to get anything, from our glasses of water, to extra napkins, to our actual food. Trying to flag down the server for our check was a nightmare. Even if the food was good, the service would have detracted from the experience. The food was not good, and I don't think I will be back.
author: Carolyn Z.

description: I love Ajisen Ramen. My favorite dish is spicy pork ramen.usually come here eat with friends
author: Clancy Y.

description:
Best ramen in the mall. 

It's a great spot for lunch on a cold rainy day in SF.

You can get it to go or sit in their restaurant on the bottom floor of the mall.

Quick service, but always busy.

The Spicy Pork Ramen is where it's at. 

As an avid ramen eater, this place is very very reliable and delicious.
author: Taylor S.

description:
This place is always busy for dinner for a mall restaurant

Had the Ajisen best combo ramen for about $11.50. Add an half an egg for an extra $0.50 cent. Average size bowl of ramen. Decent amount of pork meat. Flavor of the broth was not bad. The broth has that light taste

Didnt bring out water for my mom just cause she order a smoothie while my brothers and i had water. The kiwi smoothie that my mom had hards your head for some reason. Not sure what they put in it that my mom, one of my brothers, and myself head started to hurt.

The foods came out fast. Maybe because it was getting close to closing time. Workers were ok
author: Julie N.

description: this place is great! if you're looking for a good spot to eat and chill! i def will go again, especially when it's cold and windy because it just warms you up. i recommend the ABC ramen it has all the meats and is super delicioso. XOXO oskrtskrt
author: Oscar O.

description: Yummy, had the tantanmen and my kids had the Shoyu. Buy one get one free on the drinks!!!
author: Jon Q.

description:
I wished yelp gave the option of 0 stars or even negative. This review is based on customer service. 

Came here based on convenience. Got seated right away for a party of 4. We ordered our food and drink (I ordered water). When our food came, we still haven't gotten our water so I asked one of the workers (guy). He said okay but totally forgot so I asked another worker (girl). After about 10 mins of me asking for water 3 times, I decided to get up myself and go to the front and ask the cashier. When I got to the front, I saw cups of water just sitting out so I asked if I could just take it because I asked for it 3 times. The girl I asked for water the 3rd time mumbled "sorry, we were busy". I don't care how busy you are, I am a paying customer like the rest of the people dining here. That is NOT an excuse. When we got the check, they had the audacity to write a "suggested tip" of $7. Uh... tell me why you deserve a $7 tip when you couldn't even serve a simple cup of water? They should be happy we even tipped ($2). I won't be coming here ever again.
author: Theresa K.

description: Atleast once a week  I eat my favorite ramen. Spicy pork ramen, spicy meat on the side (just to get the right space on my taste)
author: CM A.

description:
The food is perfect 
Wouldn't change anything
Had the volcano bowl and chicken ramen

Both were perfect. 
Could eat it for days
author: Ruby P.

description: Highly recommended when you visit downtown san francisco. We ate last night and came back today. We will be back again. Hope we have one in vegas.
author: Noel B.

description:
I would realistically rate this place somewhere between 3-4 stars. Why? 

The ramen is inexpensive, and their variety is attractive. Their "ABC" ramen, aka "The Works" has BBQ pork, braised beef, and a few other yummy meats in there. If it's your first time at this place, definitely consider ordering this. Speaking of variety, their menu is growing, so now is a good time to check out the new ramen selection! 

The noodles are more "egg noodle-ish" to me. Not the traditional ramen-y noodles. Go try the noodles at Katana Ya and you'll understand what I mean. 

Service is good. This place is in the Westfield Mall so as far as "mall food" goes, this place is doing it right.
author: Greg Y.

description:
You wouldn't think of a good ramen place in a shopping centre so I was surprised to find Ajisen Ramen a few years back at the basement of Westfield. I dropped by today as I was in the mood for ramen.  The combo ramen is excellent! The tonkutsu soup base makes this ramen so good!!!  The portion size is very good as I was full by the end of it. I love boiled egg so I asked for an additional egg.

Their boba milk tea is also very good with the boba with the right amount of sweetness as it is cooked in sugar syrup (well if it is made similar to how I would make sweetened boba). You have the option to get a small or a large one (Guess what I normally get? Hint: It's not the small one).

Since the restaurant can only handle around 30-40 people (I cannot remember exactly the capacity), it can be a bit of a wait during lunch and dinner. Typically I would wait for 15-20 minutes if they are busy. Make sure you write your name and the number of diners on the paper.

Service is quick and courteous. It's not a place to vegetate as people would often eat their ramen and go. (I am looking at you vegetables!) So please keep this in mind during busy hours.

I love this place and would always strive to drop by whenever I am in San Francisco.
author: Neil Q.

description: if i Could give it a 0 stars i would. they charged us $15 and thirty two cents!! tip(18%) for extra people ????? i have never seen this before, EVEN in dim sum for 30+ people. they finessed i could buy another bowl with that amount.i would usually pay $5 tip maximum i could even get wendy's 4 for 4 menu and kfc 5 dollar fill up.
author: Allison L.

description: If I could this this place zero stars I would they finessed us cause we were a big group and made us pay $15.32 for tip I could've gotten more food by going to McDonald's money not well spent!!! I COULD'VE GOTTON BOBA WIH THAT MONEY!!!DON'T COME HERE IN A BIG GROUP THEY'RE GOING TO MAKE YOU PAY HELLA FOR TIP!!!
author: Mary N.

description: Great ramen! Great choice, excellent service. Best ramen place if you are in downtown SF
author: Jin H.

description: I've been walking around sf buzzed the ramen place is close to BART it taste good if I'm walking in sf again with a buzz I'll definitely come back here warm yummy broth, serves could smile a bit it wouldn't hurt
author: Leo C.

description: Despite 2 "vegetarian" options on the menu (soba and vegetable Ramen), not very vegan/vegetarian friendly. I wanted the ramen, and asked to substitute soba noodles so there wouldn't be egg in it; the waiter told me no without even asking the chef. So, I settled on Soba and fried Mochi. It came with dashi (fish dipping sauce) despite being "vegetarian," so I made my own using soy sauce, water, and wasabi.
