description: Not the best in the city, but convenient location drives me back here every once and a while for gyoza and beef ramen.
author: T S.

description:
Finally! A decent ramen place not too far from my work. Ajisen Ramen is a chain and fyi this location doesn't serve all the entree stated on their website...they don't have any of the salads  and fried rice dishes and even some flavor ramen like the tomato and beef ramen that i wanted to try. 

For two people we shared the spicy pork ramen and also the vegetable ramen. The noodles were very good, good consistency. Both of the broth was flavorful without tasting like too much MSG. The spicy pork wasn't spicy but it was still very tasty. Bill came out to around $20, definitely will be back to get my noodle fix!
author: Tenny W.

description:
Aiisen gets a solid 3 stars for their average ramen. I was there on a Sunday with the holiday shopping crush. Surprisingly, there was no wait and we got our table immediately. 

I had the spicy pork ramen which 3 slices of not too fatty chashu. Good so far. The keys to good ramen are the broth and the noodles. First the broth, not as complex and flavorful as the current kings of ramen shops in the Bay Area (i.e. Santoka, Santa, and Orenchi) but also not overly greasy (looking at you Halu). Second, the noodles were firm and springy and not too salty (slight glance at Santa), and is on par with most ramen shops. 

The disappointment was with the gyoza. Four pieces of tiny dumplings were all we got. Somehow, they kinda tasted like they were purchased from the store and not really made fresh there.

For the price, convenience, Ajisen is worth a visit for a quick hot bowl of ramen if you're in the area.
author: Norman S.

description: i was not a big fans about ramen, but i like this place very much, noodle was ok, i dont realy like the soup because so salty. fried calamari and spicy tuna were amazing, and service not bad （mall quick food retaurant, ）and very fast, the waiting was long, but i just wait about 10min.
author: Alex Z.

description: I love this place for their Spicy Beef Ramen and would usually come here whenever I am in Downtown. However, the price has really gone up since they opened ($7 to $10 for a bowl of ramen), or maybe I am just being cheap. The service here is fine, but not great, for it being located inside a mall. It does get really busy during lunch time so only come if you have time to spare. The servers are really friendly and try their best since there are usually two of them working. Would recommend this place to anyone who's craving for some ramen. (:
author: Yummy T.

description:
The real life Diner Dash!!

I guess ramen is the new fad because I ate a ton of ramen (literally) in 2010.  The ramen here isn't bad, but cannot be compared to Katana-Ya... but is decent for an eatery in the mall.  

Cute little Asian old ladies work in the kitchen making the potstickers by hand and the service is pretty quick (except if you go during the holiday season at lunch time). 

Boba and ramen downtown is hard to find, so if you're craving a fix, this could be the place for you. But do not come here with extremely high expectations because this place really does remind me (and others) of the video game Diner Dash... a little on the rushed side and the food a little on the mall quality side.
author: Lisa L.

description:
This place is ok in a crunch.  I used to work right around the corner from there, so if it wa really raining or I didn't feel like walking much, I could swing by here.

They get really busy, so your wait time could vary quite a bit.  If I really want good ramen, I head over the Katanya, but this place isn't too bad.

Good broths, large portions.  Friendly, fast service.  All in all, not bad for mall food.
author: Khim Y.

description:
One of my favorite ramen places of all time! I've been to the Ajisen in Irvine, and I'm excited that they opened one in SF Westfield!

There's something unique about the soup that they use for ramen that is so so addicting. They also make the most DELICIOUS popcorn chicken. When I first ordered it, I was literally expecting heavily fried and breaded popcorn chicken. I was DELIGHTED to find that it was more like the fried chicken you'd find with rice in a typical Chinese restaurant - very juicy, lots of flavor, actually tastes like CHICKEN. I've also had their boba - it's alright.

I think the way seating works at this restaurant is a little confusing - you have to line up and wait to be seated, instead of ordering in the front and picking a place to sit like most mall restaurants. YET, if you want to order to go, you can just walk all the way in to the counter and order. A positive is that it doesn't matter too much if they run out of seating because there is some communal eating area right outside!
author: Melody L.

description:
A 5-star review for a ramen chain will probably knock some off points my cred, but let's be honest: Ajisen's spicy broth is effing GOOD. I've had ramen from the most "authentic" joints this side of the Pacific (name-dropping: Ippuku in Berkeley, Izakaya Sozai in the Sunset, Orochon in LA, etc), yet none of them compare to Ajisen's. It's not that the ramen noodles are springier or the ingredients better... this Ajisen location isn't even as good as the one in Irvine. It's just that the spicy broth always has this distinct, special kick of flavor to it that other soups just don't have. Inauthentic? Probably. MSG? Most likely. Regardless, so good.

(Almost) -1 point for having horrible queuing policies. One time this rude couple cut right in front of an obvious line, and the hostess didn't do anything. Regulate!
author: Julie D.

description: Love this place! I personally like it much better than katayana. I don't get the sick oily feeling afterwards. For a ramen place at the mall it's surprisingly great! I go here all the time for the volcano ramen! So smokey and spicy and simple and hot! Hate it when places give u warm soup. Anyways it comes with a scoop of this spicy bean paste thing that gives the soup a kick! Just wish they have more meat. You only get two slices of pork and an egg. If u want something w more stuff in it I recommend the combo but that one isn't spicy. I also like the spicy pork ramen. As far as the sushi and boba it's okay. Fast service good food.
author: Lola S.

description: Had the premium pork. Nothing special. Noodle not up to standard. Not chewy enough and under cooked. Soup stock taste more like some pre-made powder mixture. OK for a quick bite.
author: James C.

description: I think Ajisen Ramen is way too hyped up and the only reason you'd really eat here is if you happen to be in the mall and you are having massive cravings for ramen.  there are definitely far better places for ramen but considering the convenience of this place for those who work in the mall or just so happen to be around.. yea. The service isn't all that great either just because they're always minding their own business and no one really goes out of there way to really talk to you or ask if you need refill on your water or drink or whatever.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Premium pork + spicy soup ftw.

Solid place. Fast service, clean and the best eats in the mall (well, that and Beard Papa.)  Not the best ramen in the bay area (all hail Santa Ramen) but its good enough to stop the cravings and postpone the the long drive to San Mateo for at least a few more months.  

I don't get people who complain about the prices.  The Ajisen ramen costs 7.50ish (my usual tops out around 11) Can't really find a bowl of ramen (Pho, yes, ramen, no) cheaper in this town.
author: Dave H.

description:
This place seemed to come out of nowhere. Pretty okay chicken katsu. I mean, it was pretty standard. There wasn't a "wow" factor to it.

The ramen noodles could have been thicker.

Overall, just okay.
author: Jay C.

description:
For being located inside the mall, the quality is better then I expected.  Ordered the premium pork ramen.  They do give you a good amount of pork, although I do prefer my pork to be more tender and melt in your mouth vs. thin and dry.  The broth is pretty flavorful, and they give you a lot of noodles.  I LOOOOVE how they pack their ramens to-go (everything is in a separate container (unlike Katana-ya, where they put everything together).  

Also got a side order of agedashi tofu, which was cheap and quite tasty.

If this was a restaurant on its own (and not in the food court, I would probably be more critical, but for what it is, I think its a pretty good deal).
author: Pornsakdi T.

description:
Premium Pork Ramen.... you are so tender. Broth you are so satisfying... and now I have an actual reason to go to the food court in the mall. 

I'm no Ramen expert, but this just might be my favorite ramen I've had so far in the city....  

I will be back. 

Oh yeah, Gyoza was superb.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Portions are small. Ridiculously long line. Bland ramen.

I don't understand why people would wait in that crazy long line in the middle of the food court for a small table to open up. My friend and I just skipped past the line to get our food to-go and find seating elsewhere. 

First, the lady behind the counter was extremely distracted and just couldn't get our order right. We had to pay for our order 3 separate times because she kept forgetting items from our order.

I got the spicy beef ramen and my friend got the spicy pork. Neither were spicy at all. I've had better ramen at relatively "bad" Japanese restaurants. Appetizers are ridiculously tiny as well. Potstickers were the size of soy beans -__-

Their boba was pretty good though!
author: Kate Y.

description: The ramen here is not as great as Ramen Underground and Ki Sushi BUT the location of being right inside the mall and the reasonable prices make Ajisen Ramen a more frequent place than the others.
author: Linda L.

description:
Didn't expect much... after all this place is in a mall.
It's not quite full service, but they try to hard to make it so. 
Came in on a whim for snacks.

Gyoza: Good price, but tiny. The photographs on the menu are deceiving. These things are tiny.

Calamari: Good flavor and texture. Serve the tentacles and not the rings.
author: Geordie E.

description:
3.5 Stars

My coworker and I popped into Ajisen for some lunch time ramen.  I had the Premium Pork Ramen.  The soup was delicious and the chashu was very tender and tasty.  I was a little underwhelmed by the noodles.  They were a little overcooked for my liking.  The service was a bit spotty.  It took awhile for our waters to show up and we had to flag down a waiter for our check.

Overall, it was surprisingly good for a mall food.  I wouldn't be opposed to coming back.
author: E C.

description: Sometime the best way to rate a restaurant is to compare it with other competitor.  Even though Aijsen Ramen serves additional snack items, I think it's quite similar to Santouka in many ways.  Both establishments are international chain restaurants with emphasis on ramen.  When it comes to ramen, Santouka wins out pretty much in all aspects from noodle to broth.  The food we had weren't horrible, and the cha-shu was decent.  It just doesn't make the grade with so many better choices out there.      Ajisen Ramen is definitely a step up from your typical instant noodle, but miles below what a truly delicious bowl of ramen should taste.
author: Roger W.

description: I got the shoyu ramen and was quite impressed given this place is in a mall food court. The broth was so good! If you're in the area shopping, getting your touristy on, this place will definitely hit the spot.
author: Selena L.

description:
Food was decent.

fried chicken-not as crispy or juicy as I'd like.

fried tofu-it was ok.  the bonito flakes were tiny.

croquette-it didn't taste fresh.

vegetable Ramen with bbq'd pork and two orders of half an egg lol-I don't understand how extra egg only amounts to half an egg.

Service was so so.

Not much to say, except we got seated quickly so that was good.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Despite the occasionally long wait, Ajisen Ramen is a must-eat for me when I visit San Francisco Centre.  Ajisen is the best ramen I've had in California.  I'm no ramen fanatic, as most bowls I've had are merely generically salty, but this ramen is something else.

It's all about the Premium Pork Ramen.  Paper-thin shaved slices of pork, perfectly cooked noodles, chopped cabbage for texture, and scallions on top.  These simple ingredients are made special because of Ajisen's broth.  Seriously, the Premium Pork Ramen tastes like liquid chicharrones.  Give me more!

I like to put a little dab of Sriracha on each bite, and cool my palate with a Grapefruit iced tea.

I've also tried the Tender Pork Ribs Ramen (tender and tasty) and the gyoza (tiny portion, but decently cheap).
author: Nikki K.

description:
First of all, let's make sure it's clear that the food of this Ramen shop is not bad, so thankful for the cooks here. 

The feedback is for the inflexible manager - the guy who is at the front. 
He is very unprofessional, unfriendly and inflexible. I waited in line for 20 mins without knowing there is sign in sheet -which was sitting on a pedestal signage in front- that I only saw after I moved to front after that 20 min of wait. But he refuse to let me in and repeated " we go by waiting list". I was very frustrated because I wasted my time and they did not let me know when I arrived that I needed to sign in. The set up of the shop is confusing - many places have sign in sheet but then you do not need to form a line. I explained to him and the girl before me testified that I had been waiting that long. But he said that "Why are you that special? You have to know how our restaurant works and it's not my responsibility to let you know".  I was stunt that he would be so hostile and inflexible. So I left and had some coffee and Quiche next door. 

I will not go again even I like the food, many other good places close by, such as Ramen Underground, Ramen bar ( not authentic but nice environment), etc.  They are much better and so friendly and I will not want to spend my time being treated this way. 

A tiny Ramen shop, when they gain some popularity, they would treat people in such a way and ruin their day, this is NOT right. You are NOT there to just FEED me, you are there to be part of my day. Be pleasant, be friendly, be like a good sports - don't be a JERK.
author: Fort Z.

description: A decent ramen joint to the Westfield foodcourt. The broth is flavorful. The noodles are a bit tough so I do not like it. The chasu is also tough making it harder to eat. The egg is fully cooked so it is not as good as a half cooked egg. The service is good.
author: Chatree T.

description: I've visited Ajisen twice since I moved up to SF, and being that I love ramen (see all my reviews for Ippudo in NY, Hakata in LA, and Ken Ken here in SF), I really had low expectations for this place, mostly because mall food is notorious for being bad to mediocre (at best).  In any case, the first time I was here I had the pork-based ramen and it was "Eh".  Certainly doesn't hold a candle to some of the perennial places on my list, but I didn't think it was all that good.  Anyway, I went here last night right before doing some serious damage at Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale, and got the Shoyu Ramen.  Understanding that I was hungry but not in the mood to deal with mediocrity again, I went with something different.  The result? I was actually surprised that it resembled something that I'm familiar with.  My friend and I split an order of gyoza and those tasted like they were reheated in a microwave, but I wasn't expecting anything great.  So to recap all of it, I would say that the whole experience overall was OK.  I certainly didn't think it was bad, and would say that it's better than the ramen experience I had at Kamakura here in the Financial District.  At ~$9.00, it's a little steep considering it's just a bowl of noodles, but I suppose you could do worse at Westfield.  Considering that it's mall food too, I'd say that it provides a reasonable example of what ramen is.
author: Lisa I.

description:
Recently opened within the Westfield Mall right next to Panda Express - I feel they should have rented out space within the food court or even outside of the building altogether. The place gets busy, and has limited seating within a very busy mall. At least you have the option of getting your food to go which I would recommend. Space is cramped and service here can be erratic. 

Tried their premium pork ramen - rich, milky broth...great flavor, but disappointed that there wasn't much in the bowl apart from the noodles, thin sliced fatty pork, and cabbage. For close to $10 a serving I was expecting more...even a larger serving would have helped. 

They have a nice selection of milk tea and flavored tea drinks. I had the mango iced tea --- like the soup, it was delicious, but a little pricey at ~$4 per cup. 

I probably won't be eating here much since it's heavy on my wallet and the portions are not as huge as a meal I could get from Coriander Thai or Sorabol Korean BBQ in the foodcourt...prices are about the same, but at least I have leftovers for another day or two.
author: Elaine W.

description:
This is a great quick bite place in the mall, that doesn't really feel like fast food (thats a good thing).  We sat down and got the beef curry ramen.  The staff was super nice, very quick to welcome and seat us, and quick to take our order.  The food came out well prepared and delicious.  Everything seemed fresh and with good presentation.

The small bite appetizers are good too.
author: Jon S.

description: I'm actually a ramen fans. I always try to find the best ramen around SF. Since ajisen ramen is very famous at LA, heard from my friends, and i wanna try it for a long time. And I only tried it recently coz i dont go shopping that much, and even dont know it has opened for a while. the one at westfield has lots of choice of ramen, compared to other ramen restaurant. And so far i tried preminuim pork, tender pork rib, and ajisen ramen, they all taste good. I also enjoy the drinks here, even i cant say it's the best, but as drinks in a ramen restaurant it's pretty good, and over average. I'd like to come back and try the rest of the ramens. The only thing bothers me is it's always a long waitlist during the lunch time, even the food is getting ready pretty fast, but i prefer coming a bit later or earlier next time.
author: Kevin W.

description:
You're in San Francisco, its cold, overcast and maybe a little wet.  Comfort food sounds good but you don't want to eat something too heavy that will put you to sleep.  The ideal food for this scenario is either Vietnamese Pho or a nice big bowl of Ramen.  And not the "Top" kind that got you through college.

Ajisen Ramen is actually a chain restaurant.  If you travel to places like Japan, Hong Kong, China, the Philippines you just may see an Ajisen Ramen in the airport or some other area where tourists go.  I guess you could call them the "Panda Express" of ramen.

If you want a top notch bowl of ramen, go to Santa Ramen or Genki Ramen.  If you want an easy, quick and acceptable quality bowl of ramen then Ajisen is a safe bet for you.  Easy access from the Powell St BART station.
author: Patrick V.

description: More like 3 1/2 stars.  Definitely a cut above for a quick bite while shopping in the area.  Not the greatest ramen, but very passable.  Seems like a fast food joint you might actually find in Japan.
author: Nate S.

description:
Premium pork ramen...YUH-MEE! Fried chicken with their lemon tasting mayonaise...YUH-MEE (I know, mayonaise as a dipping sauce wtf?? TRUST ME. Its really good!!) 
I come here all the time for lunch. I call in my order ahead of time cause the line can get pretty long. Im only giving 4 stars cause the service could be better.
author: Ellie W.

description:
[Reviewed by Kel]

Good for mall food, average compared to most other ramen shops.

It's obvious this place is a chain, because it's run like a well oiled machine. Servers are quick and efficient, and the food comes out before you can blink your eyes. Prices are similar to Katana-ya, but no waiting outside in the cold at this restaurant. Husband and I both had the corn + bbq pork ramen. I don't believe there is a choice in broth, like most other ramen houses. I asked if they had tonkatsu broth and the waitress looked at me quizzically.

All in all, an average bowl of ramen at above average prices. Will I be back? Probably. Because it's the only ramen shop in SOMA.
author: Kel S.

description: I give this place a star, because they're quick in getting my to-go order ready. The ramen isn't great.  I could tell that the noodles were not freshly made, so they might have been frozen or put in the fridge prior to placing the broth over them.  Also, the broth was a bit bland.  I ordered the spicy pork ramen and I couldn't taste the flavors of the broth.   Ajisen Ramen should seriously consider changing their noodles and broth.
author: Madonna P.

description:
I'm a fairly frequent Ajisen visitor and it's good enough to satisfy that ramen craving when you're on the go. 

I always get the Ajisen Ramen only because it's the cheapest ramen on the menu. It's aight, but as many reviewers have pointed out, the broth looks flavorful, but don't be fooled; it's very watery and at the end, I can see the fat settling at the top. 

To speak about the service, I've always had a fairly positive service experience here. I'm in and out anywhere from 20-30 minutes (if I eat quickly) so I go here when I need a fast meal. I've definitely had ramen that was cheaper and better quality, but when I'm stuck on eating some ramen during my lunch break or when I'm shopping at the mall, Ajisen is the place I go to.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I've gotta say that whenever I get a hankering for some soup and noodles (usually when I'm stressed out from school), Ajisen is the easiest place to get to. The location inside the mall is just off the exit of Powell BART so I can go in, get my grub on, and then hop on the train and make it back home in time for the latest episode of 30 Rock! Good deal sir!

The space itself is small but nice and bright and clean! They seat you right away and they're there to take your order quickly and efficiently. I always order the spicy beef ramen, I like my soup hot and spicy (in fact, I think they could take the spice factor up a notch or two but I eat fire on a normal basis so that's being a little biased). Now, I gave this place 4 stars not because it's really good ramen, in reality it's about a 3.5 but I have to give the place some credit -- for being a semi-fast food joint, the quality of the ramen is pretty spectacular (meaning to say, it's not Top Ramen!). They pack a good amount of noodles, broth, vegetables in that bowl (the ladle spoons are so fun to eat with) and the beef is nice and tender. 

All in all, it's great for when you're cold, hungry, and your feet are aching from all the countless miles you've walked window shopping (or shopping-shopping) and you're in need of some TLC in a bowl. 

Quick tip: The mango-lychee-cranberry juice may sound weird but it's so good! I want some right now!
author: Janssen C.

description:
My review of this place has been delayed because my experience here was subpar. 

I can't remember what I had because it was simply forgettable.
author: Emerald M.

description:
I have come here a large handful of times and the first time here I was in love. I had the spicy pork ramen with the honey aloe green tea and wanted to return soon. However I am sorry to say that either I don't like ramen anymore or this place is getting worse because honestly every time I go back the food and overall experience is worse and worse. I order the same ramen and drink but am no longer overwhelmed. Maybe the honeymoon period is over....

Also when it gets very busy there is a sign up sheet out front and It gets awkward because there is no room to stand and wait,
author: Adrienne C.

description:
I really liked the tonkotsu broth that came with the premium pork ramen. There was a TON of pork in the ramen, so I wasn't wanted for any meat, for sure. But the noodles were overdone! Argh. I will order them underdone next time and see if that works, maybe. I'm not sure if it's the noodle itself or if they were just overcooked. 

Overall, not bad for a mall joint. The service was a little weird and extra hover-y, but that may have just been a function of their newness. Will go back and see.
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's a good last minute choice when I'm in SF. Not very authentic but a good alternative  I'm still in pursuit for a really good ramen
author: Sheila D.

description: Their meat portioning got ridiculously small. Very disappointing!!!
author: Mich G.

description: Yeah... not exactly blow-your-effin'-mind decent or anything like that, but certainly not offensive like some of the ramen places I've happened into for a $13 bowl of Top. Not exactly non-perturbed when they get crowded, and not exactly well-equipped to deal with a cold day except to have people standing out in the mall until they can accomodate you to take your take-out order (call it in, son). Priced accordingly for a spot of this quality in the mall and slightly less annoying than dealing with the ever-present thicket of lost tourists at Katana-Ya. Definitely okayish. On a cold day, it'll do the trick, just a little better than stuffing your hands in the crotch of your pants, unless I'm the only one that does that.
author: Roy M.

description:
Not too bad at all if you are craving for Ramen when you don't really want to get out from the Mall.
I had the chasu ramen...  pork ramen with Miso base.
it hits the spot... and definitely will go back there!
author: Mel L.

description:
Location: Convenient (in Westfield old food court side)
Prices: Average $9-11 per bowl
Service: Nothing spectacular
Cleanliness: Good
Tables: Many
Ramen noodles: too eggy; not like the Ramen in Japan
Cha-shu: not fatty enough

Overall: not memorable
author: Keiko C.

description:
Pretty close, but not quite as good as the Ajisen in Fremont. Firstly, they don't have the Volcano Ramen, which is the greatest Ramen this side of the Atlantic, also, it's in a mall, so the ambience is lacking.

Good ramen though.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Ramen was of average quality and not something I would crave.  If you're hankering for good ramen, go to Katana-ya instead.  

Ramen was a tad soggy and the pork was a dry and chewy. 

Service was attentive and friendly but foodwise, nothing stood out.
author: Donna M.

description: Yummy ^___^, I like going here after walking around SF on a cold winter day. Their ramen noodles... seem kinda cheap. Their Tonkatsu broth is very mellow and not super flavorful. The girls that work there are very nice. Overall, a decent place to go.
author: Anna C.

description: This is a good and popular ramen chain restaurant. Ramens are authentic and tasty as we've sampled ramen and noodles around many Asian countries. My wife and I always stop here to catch a quick lunch when we are in the city.  I don't understand why people complaining about the wait time and fast food environment. Ramen and noodle are supposed to be served fast.
author: Zichao M.

description: Food was amazing I've had it twice now once here and once in Singapore, both time the food was great I've had the same thing premium pork with extra BBQ chicken and 1 hole egg... Food was excellent!!
author: Donald J.

description: We like to shop at S.F. Westfield, and I've been wanting to try Ajisen Ramen for a while.  When we pass by, the restaurant is always pack. We finally had an opportunity to try their ramen.  I had the seafood ramen - shrimp, scallops, mussels, seaweed and ramen, while my hubby had the chicken ramen.  The ramen was hot, flavorful and tasted good.  Our daughter had rice and the pork cutlet, but ended up eating some of our ramen soup.  The service was fast, friendly and attentive.  This is a great place to eat at the mall and grab a quick bite to eat.
author: Racquel E.

description:
The ramen from this place is inauthentic. Do not be fooled that your ramen broth is champon, because it isn't. I think it's a knock-off. The noodles are very thin and don't taste or feel like ramen noodles. The rest of the dishes are okay, not the best Japanese food, imho. It's pretty expensive too. 

Service is pretty terrible and there is a language barrier problem with most of the waiters and waitresses that it can be frustrating. I also feel the people who run this place are rude. 

There was one time where my boyfriend and I went to the restaurant to see if they were still open. Their "Section Closed" sign was out, we stood in front of the restaurant (but not too close to the entrance, maybe 15 feet away) to decide where we were going to eat. Meanwhile, this Asian guy who worked in the restaurant saw us, came to the front, picked up the "Section Closed" sign and slammed it on the ground to let us know they were closed. What are you, 5 years old? We saw the sign, we're not idiots. After we saw that we looked at each other like, "Sheesh, someone has problems." 

Every time I go back and see that guy, I always think of that time.
author: K. E.

description: Great place to eat after shopping.  I got the pork cutlet ramen but in retrospect should have gotten the spicey pork ramen.  The noodles are OK but I liked the soup base and the ingredients.  Service was fast and good and reminded me of restaurants in asia.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
love this place, food is good, a lil bit on the pricy side but considering the location is to be expected,

we order the Premium Pork Ramen, It came in a good portion and pretty good quality 
their calamari and strawberry banana drink is a must have.
The workers are very nice. Excellent customer service!

the only problem is that the place is small and when there is a lot of people you'll end up waiting
author: Jasmin Q.

description: Shouldnt even give a one star. Warm sushi, what the heck, rude to customers, doesnt believe in customer service. Way too much for ramen with vegetable and steak. Its so oily and not good at all. I will not be coming back here again. Very rude!
author: Lee D.

description: Well.. it's decent for a ramen place inside a mall. The broth was not as flavorful as I had hoped. I had the tender pork rib ramen and I have to say, it wasn't impressive. I thought the cabbage was dreadful, it was tasteless and really didn't compliment the dish at all. I also tried the caramel milk tea w/ boba and it was really sweet! The size of the boba was unique, slightly larger than the small boba and definitely smaller than the large ones; I actually enjoyed it very much.
author: Ryan L.

description:
If you're really craving noodles in broth - this place isn't so bad...if you have ten extra dollars in your wallet or purse that is. But if you're even remotely ambitious in the kitchen (and not afraid to whip up a mean top-ramen inspired dish), I could almost guarantee you could come up with something more interesting (flavor wise) than what they are serving at Ajisen. I ordered their "Chicken Ramen" which had an ample amount of meat (which was nice) & they neatly separate the broth from the noodles, chicken, chives & cabbage if you take it to go. It's not oily, which is refreshing, and the portion is substantial.

MY FINAL SCORE: 2.5 Stars (but 2 since you can't do half's)
author: Carlos H.

description: Great noodle but fucking bad service fucking guys there they are not polite with customer  . Finally volcano ramen wes good .i gave you 1 star for bad service
author: Paul D.

description: Cheap, quick, and tasty. They even have TWO beef dishes, and they're tender; the broth, beefy I don't usually eat pork, but it's actually good here. My favorite way to fuel after shopping in the mall.
author: Hannah Y.

description:
Ajisen's broth was fragrant and delicious and yes, I slurped every last drop of it!  I came by for lunch with my sis and cousin and snagged the last table for 4.  It was already 1:40PM and the restaurant was still FULL.  The service was fine - just what I would expect at a mall location.  The menus were already placed on the table, and our waitress was quick to serve us water.  She came by a few minutes later and took our orders.  I had the premium pork and they had the sparerib ramen.  

Another quick 5 mins or so, and our yummy ramen was served, ready to devour!  As expected, it was delicious!  The noodles were perfect and there were lots of thin slices of fatty pork and about 5 pieces of spareribs, tendons attached.  If you like tendon, it's great!  If not, well you can just set it aside like my sister did.   Also in the ramen was slices of cabbage.  Both ramens had the same broth, which was nice and rich and not too salty!  The meat in both ramens were tender and flavorful, esp the spareribs.  The premium pork was good, but not as good as I've had at other places.  

All in all, I was satisfied with my meal and would definitely come back!  Our meal was about $35 - pretty reasonable for a yummy lunch!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
The default broth option is tonkotsu, and it's a little watery/greasy but otherwise has pretty good flavor.  The egg is fully hard-boiled, the noodles are not firm, and the chashu leaves much to be desired.  Portions are slightly smaller than what I expected for the price.

There's plenty of better ramen elsewhere and Westfield has other superior dining choices, but Ajisen is decent enough if you happen to be shopping and want to satisfy a craving.
author: S L.

description:
Here's a funny one... My coworkers and I went here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch.  After ordering, another waiter came back and asked us what we had ordered and that they sold out of spicy noodles.  Okay, that's fine. We understand. My coworker who ordered the spicy ramen changed her order to the premium pork ramen.  Another server brought over the premium pork ramen within 2 minutes, gave it to me, so I handed it to my coworker who actually ordered the noodles. He goes "no, that's yours." I'm like "no. that's hers". 

Overall, the food was decent just like all the Ajisen's in Asia.  I've had my fair share of Ajisen's and all I can say is that they are pretty consistent in putting msg into their broth so everything tastes good but you will need to drink lots of water to compensate for the tastiness.

I had the butter corn pork ramen. So So.  
Agadeshi Tofu. Nah..
author: Virginia L.

description: Meh, real ramen this is not. Okay if you are shopping at the Westfield and need a quick noodle fix... My search for good ramen in SF continues.
author: sean l.

description:
I ran into this place while running errands. I had the soft pork ribs ramen with enoki beef roll.

I found the broth of the ramen just right for me. Not too salty and not too bland. The riblets were braised pieces of pork with the rib cartilage in each piece that was cooked down so they could be easily chewed. A couple squirts of Sriracha and that hooked it up. The noodles were also done just right. I didn't care for the cabbage because it's just cabbage. Also the seaweed could have been more fresher. Overall decent for a fast food joint.

The enoki beef roll was a bundle of enoki wrapped with a thin slice of beef. It was just okay, but I wouldn't order it again.
author: Clodel G.

description:
I ate here for the first time a couple nights ago and I was eager to try it. ( I had been recommended to try their ramen). My boyfriend and I had to wait a while to get our order in, but all the tables were full, so I understand the wait staff had their hands full. Our food was served very quickly and I enjoyed mine from the first bite. I had ordered the seafood ramen (the priciest item on the menu, but I feel I was given the quality I paid for). It was also a lot of food, and my boyfriend ended up finishing my dish for me. I would go back again, but it's definitely a splurge.

I was also there when they were closing, so they were rushing some of the tables along by bringing them their checks in the middle of the meal, although I did hear them apologize and explain their reasoning.
author: Nicole B.

description: After a hike with family and friends, we decided to eat some ramen noodles. This restaurant is located inside a mall. I ordered a spicy bowl of ramen. The soup base and spiciness was good but however I was disappointed with their ramen noodles.  It was hard and not fresh. I really wish they used fresh ramen but can't expect much from a restaurant located inside a mall.
author: Tiffanie E.

description: FAKE ramen!!! Taste the same as frozen ramen which you can buy from asian grocery. They don't even offer the same signature soft bone ramen that Ajisen famous for in Japan!
author: Ivan S.

description:
This is a pretty decent ramen place, given that it's in a food court of a mall. I ordered the spicy pork ramen, and was pleasantly surprised by the spiciness. It wasn't some weak sauce spicy, it was pretty darn spicy. And I really liked it. I ended up devouring the entire bowl, leaving only a couple sips of the soup. Delicious!

They also have a large selection of drinks: flavored iced teas, slushes, etc. I didn't try any on this particular trip, but I will the next time I go.

Can't wait to go back for some more spicy pork ramen!
author: John C.

description:
This is just bad ramen. It was OK eating it, but left such a bad after taste. I don't know what they put in it, but I have a feeling I also don't want to find out.

Don't go there unless you really feel like ramen and can't think of any other place.

The service there is quite confused and not professional.
author: Too M.

description: Although I can only justify giving Ajisen three stars, I still really like this place. It's a great spot to pick up some tasty ramen to go to bring back to your office (usually when I have enough time for a sit-down meal I'll head to Katana-Ya instead). That said, I definitely enjoy the premium pork ramen and the spicy pork ramen from time to time.
author: Aaron V.

description: Have had the vegetarian ramen a few times.   High quality ingredients, very tasty.  Almost as good as ramen in japan.   Prices are reasonable and good portions.
author: Ric S.

description: The employees here are idiots. Walked in at 9:05 pm and they turned us away saying they were closed. 5 mins later, we see them sit four people so we went back to the same server that refused us service (Umi)and she said she made a mistake and they close at 10.  The manager Tony was a total jerk too.
author: Lisa L.

description: Second time coming here.. introduced it to my friends and they loved it.  If there's a better Japanese Noodle Place than this.. let me know.  Conveniently located on the bottom floor by Union Square!!  Had the Pork Ribs.. it's good.  +the pork fat... Mmmm...  lol.
author: Mark L.

description: For this being in a mall food court.... it is pretty awesome. Busy place during peak times, you have to write your name on a clipboard and wait. Great food for the price though. I reccommend the Spicy Beef Ramen
author: Brandon C.

description: I found this place as I was cruising the mall. It was full and I was sure that it would be worth the wait. I was with a party of 6 and ordered 3 chicken ramen and 2 vegetable ramen. Wow it was worth the wait. Not only was the soup delicious, but the service was great. When I come back to San Francisco, I will come to eat Ramen here.
author: Susan W.

description: Most of you have seen my reviews on Ramen Dojo and know that they are my #1. Since then, I've tried several Ramen places including some that are revered as the best in the Bay. Ajisen comes as close to RD as I've ever tasted. Their service is great, selection is yummy and their portions are very generous! Their soup is not overly salty and the flavors in each ingredient is very tasty. I only wish their corn was sweeter. Other than that, I give this place a thumbs up! For a chain restaurant, they sure know how to make a great bowl of ramen.
author: Jorge H.

description:
I was curious to try the food here since it's opening.  I wanted something lighter and more flavorful than the generic mall type of offerings.

I picked up a late lunch there today and I was impressed.  Again the waitress was nice and quick and got to my table.

I decided to order the seafood noodles and a really good drink, the mango lychee cranberry juice drink.

The food came out lightning quick and man the  ramen was great.  It has a mussel, 2 shrimps, 2 scallops a delicious broth, cabbage, seaweed and very good ramen.  Super delicious and hit my appetite perfectly.  It felt healthy without weighing me down.  The drink was really great too.

The service was very good and the timing of the check was good too.  The staff is really young there but they know how to provide good service.

Definitely my favorite place to pick up a bite at Westfield.
author: Curtis W.

description: Ugh - save your money and buy the 2.99 packaged ramen at the store. I ordered the chicken ramen and even paid extra for it to be spicy.  The salty broth and starchy noodles were identical to what I could make at home.  The few slivers of chicken were dry. The only reason I'm not giving this joint one star is because the fried tofu was dee-lish! Loved the sauce.
author: Kim W.

description: After walking around the mall and not finding a good place to eat, I settled on Ajisen Ramen. It was pretty good and I got the japanese marble drink which brought back some childhood memories. We got gyozas and the tonkatsu pork but I think the ramen is a lot better than any of the appetizers. I was pretty satisfied with my meal and they seated us really fast.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
LOVE THE RAMEN HERE!!!
Service is great, attentive and helpful!
Will be coming back soon!!
author: Patrick S.

description: Pretty decent ramen. I like the BBQ pork with corn and the premium pork. The bf always goes for the spicy beef- extra spicy. The food is always consistent, the service- consistently mediocre at best. We usually don't have to wait which is nice.
author: Heather U.

description: Ramen places are usually not fantastic for vegetarians, but the snacks and drinks are pretty good, I'd definitely come back here if I was in the mall and wanted some food :)
author: Lana L.

description:
first time having ramen at a restaurant so don't have much to compare it to. i had the premium pork ramen which was OK but i thought it was a little too salty. luckily we ordered the seaweed salad which was delish and i think it really helped to compliment the salty soup. we also had the tofu appetizer which came with two pieces of tofu. good, but nothing too special.

service was kind of weird to me? i came in with my moms and although there were serveralllll empty tables, the waiter took us to a table where two other people were still sitting and he asked them to move somewhere else so that we could sit down. he pretty much said they could sit at another table if they wanted to keep talking but man when someone kicks you out like that, you just leave and it just felt awkward standing there waiting to sit down o_O 

we were sitting at 4 person table that was actually two 2-person tables pushed together so i had my shopping stuff on the chair next to me. when another couple came in to eat, the waiter asked me to move my stuff off the chair, and then he slid the other table just a few inches away from us and sat them there. AGAIN, there were tons of empty tables around the restaurant but here we were sitting elbow to elbow with strangers. so yea, weird service?
author: Anjelica C.

description: I was excited when I first heard Ajisen Ramen is coming to SF finally.  However, after one visit, I have to say that it's kind of disappointed.  For any of you who have been to the Ajisen Ramen in LA, don't expect the same here.  Both the noodle and soup aren't that flavorful here, and the Ramen places in J town are actually better.  But given this is kind of the only Ramen place in SF downtown, I may still come by when shopping around, but just don't expect too much here.
author: Bryan W.

description:
Was meeting up downtown at the Westfield and happened to notice this new joint while walking and got instantly excited (I've enjoyed Ajisen Ramen house overseas while traveling in china and the food there was quite decent).  

So, I stopped in there and ordered a miso ramen with california roll ( i was disappointed to see that unlike the China Branches, this branch does not offer Donburi).  The Miso Ramen was okay...not the best, but decent.  The broth was seasoned just right and the portion size was typical say the portion sizes overseas.  The Calfornia roll???  Well, let's just say that it could have been store bought...haha.

Since this is a ramen place, the atmosphere was very causual, and prices very reasonable.   Service was brisk.

I would love to have a ramen house by my work place as I work in the Mission and need an occasional break from wolfing down burritoes...but alas, at least now I can settle for some okay Japanese Ramen downtown before barting home to Contra Costa.
author: Jason C.

description: I love noodle if I say I am lover of noodles than its true . I had seafood noodle it's the best . No more critics as well as visiting there I will highly recommend people who wants to have hot & fresh noodles .
author: raja g.

description: Just finished a bowl of premium pork, side of California roll, and a calpico drink. Price / quality is about right. Good place to eat if you're already at the mall. Service can be spotty from my experience.
author: Huy T.

description: The food is not bad, but what disgust me is how the waiter/waitress handling the food. I ordered a bowl of hot ramen. A girl brought a hot bowl to me with one hand. Her dirty thumb hooked inside the bowl and touched my food.  i could of send it back, but remember what people say: Dont fight with the waiter or they will spit in your food.  I was starving so I just ate it. The food have could of taste much better if I didnt have the mental picture of her thumb in my food. If you guys reading this message. the proper way to serve the a bowl is with two hands and keep your finger/thumb out of the bowl. Thank you.
author: Hugo J.

description: Worst service ever. The guy was just standing next to me and pressuring me on to order someone when I was just simply lookig at the price. After the food came, it tasted pretty good. Except for the hair in my chicken and the carbonated soda. I asked for a new batch of chicken, but they gave me back the same one and probably spit in it too. I am not coming back here again.
author: Andy L.

description: The best ramen I've ever tasted!  The broth is packed with flavor. I've only ever gotten the premium pork and it's delicious. They give you a lot of food and a huge helping of thinly sliced pork.  I live in Alameda and sometimes I take BART just to eat at this place. It's right in the Westfield Mall, very convenient. I also buy their boba. Super chewy and yummy drinks.
author: Johanne M.

description: Ajisen is my favorite place for Ramen downtown. Surprisingly you can find tasteful ramen in the mall? I guess so. The service is so great, and the team seems efficient and ready to help whomever. I don't feel like I'm a bother which is always why I end up leaving a big tip! Go try
author: Damian B.

description: This place is not that good and not that bad. The ramen was good. the bouncy. Some other resturaunts that say the are ramen house serve ramen and not real ramen. This place's ramen were real. The waiters took long to get my check and to get a to go box, but i can see they work hard, they are all runing back and forth ordering and serving and ya they're nice. I would go back only if craving for ramen and if i am in downtown.
author: M L.

description: We came here on a cold cloudy day in the city and this totally hit the spot! We had to wait about 15 min for a table to open up but the food here was really good! This was my first time at this location, I've eaten at the Fremont location as well. I ordered the spicy pork ramen and it was to die for. Everything about it was superb! We also ordered the fried tofu and the pot-stickers.  This place, for being in the mall was a lot better then other ramen places I've been to.
author: Brian T.

description: Another Ajisen shop in the bay area, but this place does not serve any alcohol.  That's a big minus for a ramen joint :(
author: Durif M.

description: My main server was cool. But a lady came by and gave me my check while I was still eating. Umm... Who said I was finished? I wrote my yelp review and slowed my roll just to be as assy as the chick. Superbad service rating because of that. Definitely a service nono, especially after the lunch crowd has cleared. Giving someone a check before they ask, while there is food on the table is basically implying you don't want them there. The food is 5 star mallfare but I can't enjoy what I am eating when there is too much bitch in the atmosphere.
author: Savier M.

description: This was good on a rainy afternoon.  I was craving ramen as usual in the weather and after seeing some pictures from other yelpers I wanted to try the opaque pork broth.  I got the ramen with pork, corn, seaweed, and egg.  I think my favorite is still the spicy chasu ramen from Mitsuwa or one from Honolulu for flavor.  It was O-K - again, not bad for the weather.
author: Jay S.

description: Premium pork ramen is yummy. And the service is excellent -  Yuliani is awesome!!!!
author: Leeza R.

description: I ordered the miso ramen. It was OK. The service was good and there wasn't a long wait. Not a bad option if you're in the mall. If you're looking for better ramen in the area, go to Katana-ya.
author: Jim R.

description: Pretty good ramen! Decently priced, this place is a no-brainer if you're in the area. I go the premium pork ramen which was excellent. I only wish this place were in a better location.
author: Danny C.

description: If you've ever had the Ajisen Ramen in Fremont, you can forget whatever reservations that you may have made to their mediocre noodles. The Ajisen here in Westfield shopping mall is literally fresh off the boat from Japan. literally. LEGIT. The chewy noodles and rich pork bone soup is what you expect from Ajisen store. The prices are acceptable, and the menu offers a wider variety of dishes from snacks to rice dishes for those who are simply too full of eating their awesome ramen. Can't wait until the next time I'm down shopping around Westfield.
author: Brian C.

description: Very average-- granted I get the vegetarian ramen, and my coworkers (who really like this place and is the reason I go at all) really like the spicy beef ramen. When it's cold outside I'm happy to go here, as fairly flavorless hot soup is still more warming than an equally flavorless burrito that you'd find next door at Chipotle.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I really wasn't that pleased with this place... Although, what can you expect from a food court type of restaurant at the mall?  It seems more of like a quick eat place, but it wasn't horrible. The gyoza wasn't exactly what I'd hope for either, but I wouldn't really expect too much from this place.  I guess that's why they're at the mall rather than somewhere like Japantown.
author: Alicia L.

description: Holy moly this place is crazy chaotic. I waited in a huge line and the cashier was nice enough to say Sorry about the wait. As I waited in line I drooled over all the ready orders and used all my restraint to stop myself from grabbing all the ramen bowls. Because I don't run that fast and I want to come back here. I settled on curry and a mango iced tea. Totally worth the long wait!
author: Sophia C.

description: The beef ramen I had was good. The woman who served us was very nice and all smiles. That's always a good thing! I would definitely go back just to be served by happy employees.
author: Scott H.

description: This place is a very good place to eat at when you're at the mall. The service here was impeccable. They were nice and cheerful - gave a nice feel to the place. I ordered the spicy beef ramen. I also ordered a mango iced tea. The drink was pretty good ( i had a pretty low expectation at first since it was a ramen place.)The food came out quick and boy, it was really delicious. Gave a good amount of beef and the ramen was nice and firm. After I was done, they didn't rush the check at me which is a good thing because I like to sit and digest my delicious meal. Overall, I would come back again when I crave ramen.
author: Jackson C.

description:
I would have been happier with top ramen at home. This place sucks. The ramen noodles are essentially the same as top ramen, the broth is weirdly oily, they wouldn't let me get chicken INSTEAD of the pork, and there are barely any veggies.  

Our waitress was really sweet and I'm sure she was just doing her job. But the blonde asian girl was so rude! I was getting some napkins from the condiment stand and she began to reload the bins by reaching across me over and over.
author: Erin D.

description: Mediocre at best. First, I ordered the regular beef bowl. Then I asked them if they could make my broth a bit spicy. And the waiter told me to use Sricha Sauce/chili powder. Then, when I get the bill, I get charged an extra dollar for "spicy broth." Are you kidding me?
author: James V.

description: Great place, really nice people, menu is simple and easy to read. ramen has a really nice interesting flavor which every time i go, i asked for extra ramen with my meal. You won't find many ramen places like this around SF DT, also a nice place when SF gets cold at times. The menu has all kinds of combinations from pork , vegies and beef with two different kind of soup. I would recommend this place fosho
author: Charlie M.

description: Tried the Chicken Ramen and Milk Tea Boba. Both were lacking in flavor. Not going back here again... I'd rather have Panda Express right beside it.
author: Car C.

description: I like Ajisen, I first tried it when I was in Beijing. It was also a one of the chains that I went to consistently in SoCal. It is pretty good, not the best, but if you are looking for something fast, inexpensive and tasty, it's a solid choice. I thought the LA location did a better job with the ramen, but I think that's because this location is more food court-esque.
author: D C.

description: Am I missing something? What was so "premium" about the "premium pork ramen" again? If McDonald's started selling McRamen, this is what it might taste like. Noodles tasted like bad spaghetti, but the broth and pork were okay.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
DEFINITELY A 5-STAR RESTAURANT!! 

Last month i went there with a couple of my friends for lunch. Since it was the first time we went to this place, we asked the server for recommendation and he recommended the Premium Pork Ramen which we did order later on and guess what, it was SOOOO DELICIOUS. I really like the tonkatsu broth and they give you  A LOT of pork and i wanted more after i finished the whole bowl. 

We also tried the Boba Milk Tea, the Honey Aloe Green Tea and the Yogurt Green Tea. Awesome Drinks. 

By the way, their Fried Chicken and Fried Calamari are also pretty good. 

I will surely come back next time and try other kinds of ramen.
author: E S.

description:
There's a reason that Ajisen is one of the very few, if not only, Japanese restaurant chain that has been able to commercialize internationally. The food is darn good.

Just order the premium pork noodle. $10. Can't complain.
author: Jack W.

description: Oh man, I am still on a long journey to find good (even decent) ramen in the SF area. DO NOT go here. It is not good.
author: Chieko H.

description: Excellent! Fresh fried chicken, and savory noodles! Went twice in two days because it was sooo delicious. Large portions leave you feeling satisfied for hours, yet craving more!
author: R L.

description: Surprised to find this restaurant here in America since I last saw and dine at this place in Shanghai. I ordered the corn and pork ramen! It was delicious. It came in a good portion and pretty good quality. Very tasty and water much needed. Smacked right in downtown in the middle of San Francisco Shopping Center Food Court. :-)
author: Lelan Q.

description: This place is wickedly DELICIOUS! I don't know their secret ramen recipe, but I an addicted. It's so small that you have to wait in the mall area and sign you self up on the waiting list. Totally worth the wait. This is like no other ramen I've had before. The bowls are very large, too much for one meal, but totally can be enjoyed reheated. I want to steal the broth for other meals. It's pricey but OOOOHH SOOO GOOD.
author: Monica H.

description: This place is very good for fast food ramen. However, after having tried other ramen places, this place seems very generic and unimpressive. The service here is average. They give you what you order in a timely manner but there is hardly any communication. This might be preferable for other people but I personally enjoy a pleasant waiter or waitress that personalizes your experience. The chicken ramen was good but almost the same as if I were to make it at home myself. And the atmosphere is very cramped. The seating there is so compacted that it makes the experience a little unpleasant.
author: Eila S.

description: Tender pork ribs ramen is Yuuummm. Three large pieces, good broth, not salty sodium. The cabbage Cole slaw was a bit odd but ok.
author: qirk z.

description: I went to have dinner than I change my mind. The food is hella expensive so I just order the milk tea.
author: Allen K.

description: came here after SF pride! hella crowded but i managed to get curry katsu to-go. it was pretty decent, both the taste and portion. according to my friends the broth in their ramen was great too. definitely coming back for their ramen next time!
author: Louis O.

description: We just had to try it since we see this place in Asia and always wondered how it taste. I did not love it, my hubby thought the meat was not bad, but I don't think I can ever go back.
author: Eva L.

description: The soft pork boner soup is not bad.  The pork was nice and soft.  The soup made me thirsty as hell.  Genki ramen remains supreme!  $10 plus tax for ramen is kinda steep.  Its freakin noddles in broth.
author: Fatty A.

description: Thanks Yuliani for taking the time to explain mango drinks to my SweetCheeks.
author: Michael B.

description:
for a mall noodle joint, this is the best!  nice noodles, i like all things pork. the broth is good....even got the trendy flavored teas...fried tofu appetizer is awesome.  always eat here(but don't always check in).

great place!
author: Ral S.

description: Why is it so hard to find a good ramen place in downtown SF?!  It ain't rocket science, people.  Or maybe it is.  Regardless, Ajisen was a disappointment, primarily b/c their ramen noodles are NOT REAL RAMEN NOODLES!  I don't know what they are, but they are not ramen.  Seemed more like somen noodles in shoyu broth--WTF?  That said, the broth was ok and the pork was nice and tender--hence, the 2 stars.
author: Sharyn F.

description: Barted from Oakland to grab a lonely lunch.  Premo pork ramen was ACTUALLy too porky.  Ramen always seems to upset my stomach too.  No different here.
author: eric w.

description:
well how do i star here. getto japanase restaurant. the food is ok aceptable for in and out..
 the service is  horrible. japanes people dont have any clue about customer service. one of the server was hanging out with his friends and checking his email or facebook and with his laptop when the restaurant was so busy.  well maybe because they are so young and sspoiled kid they dont care about the place. anyway. im end up here  because  i was so starving  and i have 2 optioseither this place or panda express. and i dont want to talk  about panda espress. its even worse.
author: Cesar E.

description: OK kind of fast food ramen. Not much character in the broth or noodles but the chasu was passable.  Basically you get what the menu shows, no more.  It's better to be starving when you come here for ramen given the options nearby.
author: j w.

description: All I can say it this is way better than the Ajisen we have out in Fremont, but like that it is also just another fast food noodle place... the standout dish here that I had was the deluxe roast pork, which was beautifully prepared. My only problem after a couple of visits is the broth is too rich for me and the food in general is very greasy.
author: David H.

description: We enjoyed our ramen - we tried the premium pork and shoyu ramen.  Both were quite good, and the quality of the meat was very good - better than other ramen joints in the Bay Area.  Service was quick and efficient.  Ambiance is fine - it's in a mall food court, after all, but good for a quick bowl of noodles.  A welcome addition to the Westfield casual dining options.
author: Michelle C.

description: My first time visiting. My girlfriends said that it was a great quick bite. I asked what I should order because it was my first time but the cashier didn't understand. I ordered a ramen dish with egg, pork, cabbage, and fungus. The noodles were very hard so I waited for it to soften in my soup, it never did. I went to return the meal and I was told it was my fault that my ramen wasn't cooked enough and what to do next time. I wanted a refund and I was told no. Never going back. Skip this place in the mall, there are many better restaurants around.
author: Lyra G.

description: Get the premium pork ramen it's my favorite. So tasty and delicious. Good customer service. I dont understand the low ratings but do give it a try. its worth it i promise
author: Kani C.

description: I got the spicy beef ramen soup and the boyfriend got hte shoyu ramen. The restaurant is located in the food court which was a little surprising. The ramen was ok but it was nothing super special. It was a good portion and the price was ok but i won't be going back for the ramen. I think i have had better ramen.The drinks they offer though are different.  I did get the mango strawberry lychee drink which was really good. I'll be back to try the others.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Came in today to order Ramen To-go and was greeted almost instantly by a waitress. Placed my order of "Premium Pork" ramen & their strawberry banana smoothie to-go. They neatly packed the Noodles, meat, and broth in different containers and double bagged it tight so it wouldn't spill. And best of all I only had to wait approx. 4-5 minutes for both my ramen & smoothie to be finished! I was in, out and enjoying my ramen in no time!
author: Wooodis D.

description: It's decent and since I haven't really eaten at a ramen house before, I'm not sure how the prices compare. Kind of weird being in a sit-down place being served by someone surrounded by mall fast food joints such as Panda Express and Sbarro.
author: Kim L.

description: Fast service, easy access to the mall and transportation
author: Tony K.

description: As mentioned in other reviews, the noodles are not actually ramen. You can do way better even without leaving the mall.
author: Ben C.

description: Higher prices, narrower selection and quite possibly smaller portions than other locations of this chain.  Quality is there but, it feels that they skimp on the food to pay the high rent at this shopping center.
author: Kenny L.

description: I ordered the Spicy Pork Ramen and they used "ramen" noodle that looked and tasted like capellini pasta, not okay.  The broth was good and so was the meat but not good enough for a ramen noodle house to not use ramen noodle.  I don't know if this is the standard noodle used or if they ran out and served the cheapest noodle they could find at Safeway.  I will not be going back.
author: Linda W.

description: I didn't know there was a ramen place in Westfield! We had to wait about 10 minutes for our table since it was pretty packed, but they were nice to seat us 3 in a 4 person table. I'm a fan of tonkotsu pork ramen so I ordered the premium pork with extra cabbage(no charge!) The ramen wasn't served extremely hot, but at the right temperature where I didn't have to wait long till it cooled down. A plus for me. I also brought a box of Beard Papa's cream puffs for dessert. Japanese ramen and Japanese style cream puffs = best lunch ever :)
author: Karina C.

description: Very busy place and very well organized.  They will give you a number ticket and call you when your table is ready.  I had the beef ramen and it was delicious.  Baby octopus and a baked beef enoki roll which was really good as well.  The service was quick and sweet  Lots of different types of Ramen to choose from .  Will definitely going back for more
author: Don J.

description: This place is hella good.  Get the premium pork - it's shaved super-thin.  Ajisen Ramen is also over-staffed which is much better than being ignored.  It feels like a real restaurant, not fast food.  Go now!
author: Rick Y.

description: This awful excuse of a restaurant is staffed by terrible, lazy employees who only care to close up and leave early. When I arrived 15 minutes before closing time, they were already closed, refusing to accept anymore would-be customers. This happened to me TWICE. If you are open till 8:30, then you have to accept customers up to the last minute, last second before closing time. It does not mean your staff can close up shop and leave at 8:30. Very unprofessional. I will never come here again. There are much better ramen restaurants elsewhere anyway, like Santa Ramen, Ramen Dojo, Himawari...
author: Raymond L.

description: Mall ramen FTW!  I only wish that they had spicer broths.
author: V L.

description: The premium noodles are so good! I would come back and eat at this place again. I also like their tapioca drinks. Their the only one that serves tapioca drinks in down town SF. The workers over there are very nice. Excellent customer service!
author: Kevin D.

description: I had the scallop ramen. Ramen is too soft and thiner than what I normal get from other ramen shop. Nothing too special about the soup. I was curious to try this place and now I know.
author: Marty N.

description:
My cousin was in Shanghai for 6 months and she said Ajisen Ramen WAS the reason why she gotten fat.  I finally got to try it after months of anticipation.  Usually when I go to a restaurant with expectations, it failed to meet them.  But Ajisen actually met my expectation and it was definitely a pleasant surprise.  

I went during lunch time on a weekday just right before lunch rush.  Trying to decide between many ramen options but opted to go with the roasted pork ramen.  It was the most popular ramen according to the waitress.  It was BBQ pork sliced paper thin layered on top of milk like consistency broth.  My friend got the beef ramen and we both thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  

I have already recommended it to my families and friends to eat there.  The location is downtown SF, if it was a more convenient location and parking friendly, I will definitely eat more often there.
author: Samantha C.

description: I love their spicy pork ramen and I add corn. They are quick and package everything separately when I get it to go. Great place if you are in the mood for ramen. Very convenient when shopping at the mall.
author: Dawn B.

description: I didn't have high hopes for a ramen place in the basement of SF center, but I was pretty impressed by the broth and quality of the noodles here ... flavorful and delicious.  Much better than a lot of the ramen places I've tried in/close to J-town and San Mateo.
author: Melinda C.

description: Good ramen among the ones I've tried in bay area. Their soup base are tasty especially the premium pork ramen. Their appetizers are good too! I like their fried potato cakes alot! And surprisingly their tea drinks are not bad in a ramen place. I'm always craving for their ramen =)
author: Stephanie C.

description: You call this ramen?!  The noodles were not really ramen, just cheap noodles.  I would even prefer the Maruchan packaged ramen noodles.  Also, way too expensive for what you are paying!  Might as well go to Katana-Ya near Union Square for the real thing and the same price.  Giving it two stars because this place has boba, a major plus.
author: Laura W.

description: I didn't think they will have one here since this shops only in Asia! This place is good. I got the pork premium noodles. Mmm. Pricey though for a small bowl
author: Vivian L.

description:
The VERY first time we had this was in HK!!! They're everywhere!! So when I saw the cute lil Asian girl on the poster, I asked a worker if it was part of the same chosen as HK...he said yes !!!! Wahooo!!! Our experience in HK was pretty good. So might as well try it here right???
     I got 1 order of the premium pork ramen and 1 order of the pork rib ramen. When it says premium pork, I really expected pieces that were really tender, flavorful, etc..., the pork was paper thin!! I guess that means u don't have to chew as much??? Ok well that grew me off... The rib ramen was way better in flavor..similar to the tenderous rib ramen at Genki ramen on Geary....just a fast food version. But overall it wasn't bad. Soup base wasn't bad either...I think I have other places I would prefer to go to (like genki) but if ur downtown, and want ramen asap, this place will do...prices r so so....similar to genki...but less than Santa...
author: LM J.

description: This place has awesome Ramen. When I ate here I got the premium pork ramen, some fried tofu, and a oolong tea. The broth for the pork ramen is some of the most delicious stuff I have ever had. It is incredibly creamy and full of rich fulfilling flavors. I had always heard that tonkotsu ramen like this was incredible, but I had no idea now mind blowing it was. If you love good food, you owe it to yourself to eat here. You will love this place.
author: David M.

description:
i thought this place was going to be better. its a new small sit-down restaurant inside the westfield mall. i came here for lunch last week and was very disappointed by basically everything. 

the soup base tasted like something out of a hong kong packaged instant noodle and it was way too bland. 

it was not worth $11, and i wont be going back again
author: Jenny G.

description: I like this place.   I guess for a chain resto its pretty good.   Not too many places in SOMA where you can get decent ramen so this place gets an extra star.   Premium pork and the beef curry are my go to dishes.
author: ray s.

description:
Today, I had the chicken ramen as take-out for dinner. The service was poor. After my friends and I ordered, the cashier made us wait outside. He also got my friend's order wrong so we had to wait even longer. 

The chicken ramen itself was mediocre. The ramen noodle was stuck in one big clump. They only gave me a few pieces of cabbage and the soup was kinda weird tasting. The chicken itself was pretty good, if a bit bland. 

Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant. Maybe dining in is a better experience but I won't be going again to see.
author: Mimy P.

description:
while the premium pork ramen is good, it's not the best ramen in sf.
while this ajisen is better than the one in irvine, it's not the best ramen in sf.
it just isn't...
author: Christopher L.

description: I'm always on the lookout for Bay Area ramen spots, so I decided to give Ajisen a try. For around $8, I've had decent to great ramen in the past, so I expected to at least like my meal.  I did not. I ordered the Chicken Ramen. Service was good and speedy, but the food was mediocre. Broth had flavor, but nothing exciting, noodles were decent, if not a bit soft, chicken seemed like strips bought from Safeway, and barely any vegetables. The entire time I was eating, I thought, "I could fix this at home." A bit better than Top Ramen / Maru Chan, but only a bit.
author: Ishmael E.

description: Their noodles are so YUMMY, just like the ramen I have had in Japan! It was a great lunch experience. Definitely will go back again and try different flavors.
author: Jelly G.

description: The curry rice and croquettes were awesome, but service was incredibly slow. At the end of the meal, we had to ask two waiters for a takeout box and both of them forgot. Still, three stars for the good food. I'd definitely come back, but probably when they're less busy.
author: Kiana H.

description: I liked their bubble tea.  Our ramen was descent ( Miso BBQ  Pork Ramen, and tender pork rib ramen).  A cheap quick eat.
author: Elena L.

description: Love the vegetable ramen, premium pork ramen, spicy pork ramen, fried tofu, fried calamari and mango ice tea. Staffs are very alert and ready to serve you. Very satisfied over all!
author: Sorn C.

description: Food here is actually pretty good. Good selection of ramens and starters. I especially like the spicy pork ramen. The gyoza and california roll is pretty good too.  You can opt to eat in or take out.  The service is spotty-2 stars. They're nice but we had issues with getting our water, the ramen came before the starters and the waitress could not understand that we wanted to share the ramen.  Ajisen is a  nice addition to the westield mall, just get your food to take out vs eating in, at this location.
author: Ka C.

description: Went here for lunch today and ordered the Ajisen combo, croquette and honey aloe green tea.  Everything was delicious!  The service was great.  I wish other restaurants had nice employees like Ajisen. I would definitely go back and try other ramen noodle soup.
author: Mrs. F.

description: Their spicy pork ramen is so yummy ... I am so addicted to it !! It is pretty spicy ... no kidding ! But that's just the way I like it . Their brown sugar milk tea and yogurt green tea are pretty good too . Funny because I didn't expect mall food to be this good ... esp. not a ramen shop . Also , I think it's pretty nice how it's more like a restaurant where you sit in and dine instead of the mall where you eat in the food court . The service here isn't that great because I don't think the workers are that experience but who cares , their food is good so I can forgive the service .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Came here with a friend for lunch on a weekday. I got the miso ramen, and she got the ajisen ramen. 

Broth: Her's was better than mine.. by far. I could barely taste the miso flavor in the broth. It tasted more like tonkotsu ramen than miso ramen. Broth was also lukewarm.. however this was a minor issue.

Toppings: There were a limited amount of toppings in the bowl. The pork was good, but nothing else was memorable. 

The portion size was a tad too small for an $8+ dollar bowl of ramen.

Furthermore, I was confused by the ordering system. They have a counter where you can stand in line to order....and they have waiters that take orders for you. Perplexing, and slightly annoying.
author: Jim Y.

description: Every time I shop in downtown I would come here to eat because it is convenient since it is downstairs from nordstrom.  I actually came here 3 times with my boyfriend already and we've tried premium pork, spicy beef, chicken karagge, and for drink--green apple ice tea. I would say my favorite is premium pork Ramen thus far.  The spicy beef is too spicy for me.  The chicken karagge is okay and the green apple ice tea taste exactly like green apple.  It ranges from $8.00+ for the Ramen and it fulfilling for the portion they give you.
author: Lee C.

description:
3.5 stars

Is this the best ramen I've had? No, not by a long shot. But it is pretty good, not great. I thought my "Ajisen Ramen" with pork broth was tasty enough. The meat was very nice and tender. I tend to like more toppings in my ramen though. But for mall food, I think it's a great option, especially if you've exhausted your options on the other side of the mall in the new food court.

It's sit down with waiter/waitress service. My service was very fast and efficient. But it seemed like they forgot the dude next to me's order. He was there before I arrived, I ordered and got my food while he was still sitting there. Eventually he complained and left, so even though my service was good, it clearly wasn't good for him.

Ramens are in the 8-11 dollar range. It's not cheap, but the portions are fair. Seems like most things in the food court run you about that much anyhow. The other day I had the fish taco meal with a soda at Rubio's and that was already 9 dollars, so I think Ajisen offers a pretty good comparable value. I'll go back for sure for the convenience and it does the job when you have a hankering for ramen.
author: Karen J.

description:
Ordered the premium pork noodle twice in the last visit.  Yum!~~  Quality wise it surpasses Santa Ramen and Himarawi in San Mateo.  They do keep the quality of meat and noodle up.  

I took off one point because they made an error in drink order.  Seems like they are a bit overwhelmed with so many fans coming in daily.  And waiting in line for a seat can be caotic.  Given the volume of customers they are obviously short staffed.  Or they need a better system in work distribution.

Remember to order: Premium Pork Noodle. Premium Pork Noodle. Premium Pork Noodle.Premium Pork Noodle.Premium Pork Noodle.Premium Pork Noodle.
author: F L.

description: I had the best combo ramen. it was very good. Service was good and the price was ok too. I will back again
author: Kenny L.

description: Great ramen...reminds me of Japan...the soup was quite tasty...a bit of a line waiting to be seated--a sign of a good place to eat...
author: Colin P.

description: I crave this place! I am a ramen fanatic and love me some gooood ramen! Located in the food court at the San Francisco Center mall already gave me low expectations of this place, but I was surprised at how authentic the ramen was. I have to say that this place does not have the best ramen that I have ever tasted in my life, but it is the best ramen that you can get without having to wait in a 30 minute line. (This is a direct slam against Katana-ya). I have been here 3 times and have ordered the corn with BBQ pork ramen twice and can I tell you, I was literally smiling as I picked up my chopsticks and spoon and dug in. I have also ordered the spicy pork ramen which the waiter said was his favorite, but I didn't think this one was as good as the corn BBQ. It has a good spicy kick and the broth was light and flavorful, but I think I just love the sweetness of corn mixed with miso. The waiter said that the tender pork ribs ramen was the most popular so if you're a first time go-er, this one will probably be a safe bet.
author: Kristina W.

description: It's alright.  Not the best but not the worst ramen I've had.  I think it's a bit overpriced for the quality of the ramen.  The noodle is the thin kind of ramen noodle.  Cooked perfectly I thought.  The broth was just salty without having any real pork taste to it.  Service was good.  Katanaya is still my fave and the best ramen joint in the city.  Walk a few more blocks to Katanaya if you want real good ramen next time.
author: Uinii H.

description:
